text: Let's just say I found a new favorite breakfast spot in Charlotte. The Southern Scramble was amazing and I'm not big on cheesy but they were delicious! Normally when I eat out I have leftovers, but today I cleaned my plate. The atmosphere is fun and the customer service was great. I will definitely be back.

We've been here at least five times since moving to Charlotte...and it never disappoints. Worth the wait if there's a line, with two or four people the waits never more than 10-20 min. I've had the high flyer, the benny, veggie scrambles, chocolate chip pancakes. Any breakfast we've had has been excellent. I always want to try the lunch/dinners but am a sucker for breakfast foods. The biscuits are huge. Service is fast and generally solid.

We went for breakfast on a Tuesday morning. I got the Southern Scramble and it was wonderful.  So incredibly tasty and fabulous.  The grits were also very good, but my goodness, there was so much butter in them they should call them "Butter Grits".  My dad got the biscuits and chicken sausage gravy and here is where things went wrong.  I also got a side of the chicken sausage gravy to go with the biscuit that came on my plate.   The outside of the biscuit was hard and the inside seemed undone.  The top of the biscuit had SUGAR.  Bleh.  While I liked the flavor of the chicken sausage gravy, my dad didn't and then complained of the taste "revisiting" until lunchtime.  Neither one of us liked the biscuits at all, which is odd since the name of the joint is Biscuit Café.  They state you can order toast instead of the biscuit ... so will do that next time.  The apple butter in a squeeze bottle is very good.  Will try that on the toast next time.
I have always had good experiences here. Food great staff friendly and helpful. Healthy food! It's nice to go to a restaurant with so many tasty but healthy food options.

Great place to have a very filling breakfast.  Being from NJ, I never had grits so when I tried their Creamy Dreamy Grits-- I became a fan of grits..haha  Good food, good service  usually has a line and wait!

The food tasted ok, but that was about the only thing It had going for it. Well, everything except for the biscuit, which was hard. If a place with Biscuit in the name can't get Biscuits right, there's a problem.   Service was incredibly bad. I'd expect better service at a Waffle House or a Truck Stop. Took forever to get anything from the Waitress.  The atmosphere was pretty much 100% pure hipster. I was expecting to see the wait staff roll up on a Segway wearing a Fedora.  The prices were a LOT higher than I would expect for what you get.

After a night of sickness from Mexican cuisine, my mother suggested I keep it organic and simple. In walks The Flying Biscuit Café suggestion.  The spot is trendy and cute with a sliding garage door to merge inside and outside seating. My mom and I dinned outside on the inexpensive chrome table and chair set.  It was adorable and reminded me of my Barbie set as a child.  Chicken Biscuit Pot Pie was my order and my mother went with eggs, sausage, and pasta.  My food wasn't bad, but it is not the pot pie your mother makes.  The food on my mom's plate was screaming try me, so I did and was surprised.  Everything was blended so well on her plate, but the taste was separate.  I tasted the eggs, pasta, sausage, and greens all separately even though it was on my fork and in my mouth at the same time.  Talk about an inability to marry ingredients. I sucked down two oversized cups of cherry soda, paid the bill and tip to the friendly server, and we left.  If you are looking for super-tasty food, I would not make this place your top pick.  But if you are looking for food that is organic, filling, and has a very different taste, I would pull out a chair and prepare yourself for a healthy meal courtesy of The Flying Biscuit Café.

Fantastic grits! I've worked my way through more than half of this menu, and I haven't been disappointed once.   Favorites: Southern Benedict, chicken pot pie, turkey hash, black bean cakes w/egg (perfect eggs I think it's called).   The wait can be rough on weekends, but it is completely worth it.

I have a friend who loves this place... My third visit, I just don't understand it. The chicken in my wrap was just terrible, I couldn't eat it. I wonder if it comes in pre-cooked? The only redeeming factor would have been the biscuit , however I never got my promised biscuit. Tried to flag down server, but it did not work. I hope I don't have to return.

The Flying Biscuit Cafe does what it does well.  My main objection is to what it does.  They put sugar on top of perfectly good biscuits, they put sugar in otherwise delicious grits, and then they serve only turkey bacon and chicken sausage.  Pork is the State Vice, for goodness sake, why serve breakfast meat that does not have pork in it?  The array of omelet and egg dishes is quite impressive.  I enjoyed the Piedmont omelet despite the pointless pork substitutes.  OTOH my wife's potatoes were lukewarm to cold, and her eggs definitely were not cooked as she ordered them.  The service was impeccable and the decor is adorable.  I can see why the place is so popular.  But their choices are not for me.

Since moving here, I've been on a mission to find the best breakfast/brunch spot.   The results:  Flying Biscuit is winning.  Everything I've had has been deeeelicious.  They have large portions, the service has always been fast and very friendly, and the price is perfect.  So, the food.  The biscuits (served with everything) are just an extra little bit of happiness to go along with your already perfect breakfast.  They go splendidly with whatever that delicious cranberry apple butter concoction is... oh, and the creamy, dreamy grits!  They really are creamy and I have had many dreams about them.    My favorite breakfast dishes are the egg-ceptional eggs (black bean cakes, verde salsa, feta, and sour cream with eggs) and the piedmont omelet (the goat cheese is just right).
Great brunch. Waited in line to eat, but moved quickly. Biscuits and apple cranberry butter lived up to the hype. Prompt service, friendly staff and wonderful food. The original is the best.
AMAZING!!!!! The service was great, the food was sooooo good and it came out very fast. I had the chicken sausage gravy and biscuits with the potatoes. The food for the price is perfect!!!

Stumbled upon this restaurant during our trip to Charlotte while looking for breakfast place.   We absolutely loved this place and were here twice on our 4 days trip. Staff was fantastic and we experienced some good southern hospitality. Our trip was 3 months ago and I'm already drooling thinking about how the food was. It was good.   Will defineltly will be back on our next trip back to Charlotte. Wish we had something similar in Toronto!

Disappointed was how we felt this past Saturday morning after breakfast at the Flying Biscuit in Charlotte. Having frequented the original in mid-town Atlanta when we lived there and eaten my send-off breakfast at the Roswell location when I started my AT thru-hike I am a veteran of the establishment and the Charlotte location does not do the name justice. The biscuit was a heavy lump of dough - no 'flying' to it. The omelette was also flat - totally deflated. The pancake my husband was served was almost burnt on one side (the down side of course), it was replaced but honestly wasn't much better - dense and not very tasty. The grits were okay. Sorry, this is one place I would avoid.

I can't say enough about this awesome spot. I've been here a few times, but today was by far the best. Our server was Mike I believe. He had dark hair. He was absolutely amazing! So incredibly friendly, patient, and accommodating. I never felt rushed to order, eat my meal or leave. It was such a wonderful experience to just relax and not feel rushed. Thank you so much for the awesome service! This is about 40 minutes from my house but worth the trip! We will be back!

I come here pretty often. The staff is very friendly and the breakfast is great. I'd give 5 stars but I've been disappointed with lunch and dinner.   If you are looking for a reliable and delicious breakfast place, this is a great option. If you want lunch of dinner, I'd recommend looking elsewhere.
Food and service were both good. We are from out of town and this was a better option then ihop or any of the chain restaurants. We came in from breakfast. The grits were amazing.
Slamming.  Definite satisfaction.  9.2-10 stars.  Waitstaff was great, biscuits with the apple butter.....  Classic.  Then a lot of options without the pig.

Disgusting. Southern eggs Benedict. Cold hard biscuit topped with ice cream size scoop of pimento cheese. Ice cold pimento cheese. Poached egg and A teaspoonful of hollandaise sauce. Asked for pork bacon received turkey bacon. Turkey bacon yuck. I would rather have strips of cardboard soaked in liquid smoke then turkey bacon.
My oatmeal Soysage and mimosa was excellent I come for the biscuits and was shocked to find out I had to pay for them at this location

Amazing food!  I think they have the best grits that I have had. Creamy and smooth grits with just the right amount of seasoning. The biscuits just melt in your mouth. Awesome service and no wait on a Saturday morning.

The Shrimp and Grits is nowhere near an Award-winning Shrimp and Grits...it's liquid like Gerber baby food...the shrimp was good but over cooked...then the greens wasn't completely cooked...they where hard and crunchy...the water was amazing

I am drafting this review as I sit at a table of six, enjoying fresh O.J. and the Awake blend of Tazo tea.  The atmosphere is perfect for a hungover Saturday, but we had been sitting for 20 minutes before we were asked for our order.  Forty-five minutes later, no sign of our food.  And the waitress is oddly quiet.

The only way these biscuits are going to fly is with a solid rocket booster. They were dense, gooey, and room temperature.  Not being mean here, but honest. I've had better frozen and canned biscuits.  The gravy had so much sage I felt like Thanksgiving had exploded in my mouth. I had hoped that other menu offerings lived up to the hype, but I got a resounding "NO" from my table mates. On the upside, the service was lightning fast. Our food appeared almost instantly, which tells me it was sitting in a chaffing dish waiting for us to walk in. I've heard wonderful things about this place for years, and we were SOOOOO disappointed. You'll get a better breakfast at McDonald's for fraction of the price.

Server Monique was awesome! I tried the Cola Barbeque Collard Green burrito. Much better than it sounds. The squished up macaroni and cheese baked into squares was strange. The biscuits were flavorless. My husband didn't care for the fried green tomato appetizer. The décor was colorful and fun. I am not sure that my children would eat here.
This was our first time at flying biscuit... and this is what I found mid-bite...hair embedded in my biscuit. Yuck.

Flying Biscuit is the best breakfast in Charlotte! The food is simple but really well prepared.  The ingredients are really high quality - super fresh eggs,  tasty local chicken sausage,  tender steak,  fluffy biscuits,  and the gold standard in grits.  I can't say enough good things about the Flying B! There is often a wait, but it is always worth it!

Maybe I'm the anomaly, but I found the breakfast here to be ok at best. Everyone I asked about breakfast in Charlotte kept referring me here, so it had to be amazing, right? wrong.  The egg-ceptional eggs were... ok. There was nothing eggceptional about them. The highlight was the black bean cake with the tomatillo sauce. I found myself enjoying that more than the eggs. Even the coffee was just ok.   Sadly, just nothing wowed me like I was expecting this place to. Oh well.
Food was really good and they had vegetarian and vegan options. I had the tofu scramble and it was really good. The service was excellent and I'll definitely be back. A great day off treat.

Always quick, friendly, and providing quality dishes.   Service is usually on point in regards to refills, menu knowledge, speed, and overall attentiveness.   Food is consistently good. Especially as a vegetarian or vegan it's great to have quality options.

Who would have thought that you could serve such awful food and get away with it. We had the green tomato BLT - day old bacon and a greasy tomato on dry bread; the quesadilla wasn't any better, dry and poorly presented. But worst of all was the server had such long nails she could put the plates down properly, guess she was scared of breaking a nail - very unhygienic me thinks. Maybe breakfasts are better but avoid all else.

My first excellent experience with Flying Biscuit was in ATL. I was so excited when they came to Charlotte, and they didn't disappoint! The staff here is always friendly and the food is delicious.   The shrimp and grits are among my favorite anywhere! The grits are, in fact, creamy dreamy and the roasted red pepper and tomato sauce is delectable. YUM.  Awesome omelets. The turkey hash is amazing...the slow-roasted turkey pot roast melts in yer mouth! The biscuits (served with everything) are pretty good, but the Apple Butter will keep you coming back!

Being from California, we were looking for something prominent to the region. This didn't disappoint. We tried out a variety of the menu from eggs, sausage gravy, the biscuits, potatoes, waffles, grits, and sausage. Very delicious and we look forward to trying it again in other areas!

1. Definitely recommend trying if you haven't been there before. 2. The biscuit was not as good as I expected. Not really that fluffy. 3. Oatmeal pancake is good, just a little bit dry. 4. The portion is HUGE. If you have a small stomach the $11 you spend will give you three meals.

Super fun and relaxing setting! It was a nice little brunch spot, so many options on the menu that you couldn't go wrong with. The biscuits were good (a little too doughy for my liking), the potatoes were excellent along with the pumpkin spice mimosa (very sweet!). All around a great spot to grab some good food and relax
Outstanding!! Came here for brunch, left a very happy person! The grits are incredible...a must have.

oh my. this place reminded me of our favorite brunch spot in San Fran. Let's start with the truly delicious cranberry apple butter and biscuit. The biscuit was big, fluffy and so good! The spread was fruity, a bit tangy and also surprising.  I ordered the Turkey Hash. (i just had to take a moment when remembering how life-changing this was). It was melted cheese over scrambled eggs over turkey roast over rosemary potatoes. holy kanoli - I want to go back. I maybe might have a new goal to find something equivalent in Houston.  The service was good, the environment was very laid back and the prices were great. My turkey hash was $9. My friend ordered the eggseptional eggs on black bean cakes. Hers was also very tasty. very, very impressed with this find and so glad my friend took me here.

We went here because the reviews, it seemed like a great spot. Went there once and will never go back. The service was fine, but the food... it was not good at all. They have a unique menu, but out of three of us, all ordering completely different stuff, nothing was good, at all. Food was very salty, greasy and heavy, yet not as tasty as you'd expect. Very dissappointing!

After reading all the good reviews, my niece and I decided to try the location of Park Road. The service was very good and the place is happy and upbeat, but the food, especially the biscuits, which is their namesake, left a lot to be desired.  I ordered the biscuits eggs and gravy and it was unlike any biscuits and gravy I've ever had. The gravy was over powered with an onion powder or maybe actual onions or whatever.  I couldn't get past it. it was very thick, almost to the consistency of stuffing, and it tasted as Bad as it looked. The biscuits were hard and crumbly.  I'm not sure if that's how they're supposed to be, but I can't imagine that this place gets such rave reviews with those kind of biscuits.  It was just all so odd. They do have a very large and varied menu, so if I ever find myself there again, I'll certainly try a sandwich and skip the breakfast altogether.  My niece did not eat her biscuit at all after trying a bite of it, but did enjoy the rest of her meal.
Food was delicious! Grits were amazing and I'm not even a fan of grits.  The pancakes and french today had an amazing flavor!  Would definitely recommend!

I had th piedmont omelet at the flying biscuit, with grits, a biscuit, and apple butter.  It was very tasty. Service was very good, seeing that we were a party of almost thirty.  I will eat there again.
Literally waited over 30 mins for a salad. Disappointed because this place has a lot of good reviews from the friends.
I ordered the Mexican breakfast burrito and it was delicious! Could have passed on the side of moon dusted potatoes though, not sure what the hype was about there...

I'm a Northerner.  We don't eat grits where I'm from, but Flying Biscuit changed that.  Their grits are phenomenal.  Breakfast all day.   It's my favorite meal and I can never figure out why more places don't offer this sort of thing.  Reasonably healthy menu options (even their bacon is turkey bacon).  Eclectic decor.  Fast and friendly service.  Moon dusted potatoes are OK, but not great.  They serve these or grits with just about everything on their menu.  Have some inventive menu options:  Coca-Cola BBQ salmon, various black bean dishes, BBQ chicken burritos, etc.  I visit this location or the one off of Rea Rd about once per month.  It's always good but never "pick up the phone and call a friend" good.

Had their Benny.  It was amazing! My husband had the French toast.  It was also really good.  The raspberry compote made the dish.  Biggest surprise...the fantastically creamy grits!  I chose to add syrup.  Great experience!

Service was very good! She was super sweet. The food is almost excessively rich- it's the South! Go with the shrimp and grits! Wow! Clean and comfortable place. So much better than stopping of at a chain breakfast place.

Yes, it's a chain. You wouldn't know it, though, except that the ceiling tiles are screen printed instead of hand painted with winged biscuits and other such culinary literalisms. For some reason, that element makes the Charlotte locations smell of franchise. Otherwise, the interiors do a decent job pushing the pretense that the restaurant is in a converted bungalow near those of the original Biscuit in Atlanta's Candler Park, or that it is a hometown diner that has been there for years instead of doing business in Charlotte's newer and oldest shopping centers.  Lines form on weekend mornings with people salivating over the breakfast served all day on Fiestaware, especially the biscuits sprinkled with sugar and served with homemade cranberry apple butter. And those grits. Those creamy, dreamy grits that made this lifelong grits detester see the light at the end of the hominyless tunnel. Grits can and should be made with heavy cream. If they aren't, they aren't worth eating.  Lunch and dinner options are as tasty as those from the breakfast all day menu; many are altered with eggs or the lack thereof to make them appropriate for the time of day. Case in point: Egg-Ceptional Eggs and Love Cakes, both of which are in the Top Five Favorites dishes of this writer. Daily specials are posted on the boards outside, and are usually worth a try. Menu substitutions are easy, and so is the staff, which in general is pleasantly attentive.  Though it is not a Charlotte original, we'll claim it as our own, if only for those devilishly alluring grits.  Flying Biscuit has two Charlotte locations; one in Stonecrest Shopping Center at 7930-A Rea Road and the other in Park Road Shopping Center at 4241 Park Road.

While the food was respectable, the service was almost non-existent.  We were told we would be seating within 5 minutes and found ourselves sitting down 45 minutes later.  And, only when we complained.  Waited for ever to get waited on and good luck finding someone who would take our bill.  Nothing really great to say about this experience.  Two stars for just showing up!

The French toast is dry, the greens were not good.  The biscuits are dry.  Also you get the feel the plates and silverware are not clean.  Sorry looks like a  hip place to eat but they need to work on the food.

The food was ok, the menu had nothing but turkey/chicken sausage on it, no beef or pork to be found. Our server was horrible and rude, he impatiently tried to rush us to order then rolled his eyes when we told him it was our first visit. By boyfriend had the grilled chicken wrap, and the tortilla was super hard. My biscuit was cold, and collard greens still had some unchewable stems on them. I wanted so badly to like this place, the place looked great, really laid back and fun. Due to the horrible service and mediocre food, I am sad to say I will not be returning.

When I moved from ATL to CLT in 2006, Flying Biscuit breakfast was one of the things I missed most about Atlanta.  This location on Park Road is, in my opinion, even better than the originals in Atlanta (perhaps I am simply desperate for a good Flying Biscuit here).  Great biscuits and gravy, super omelets.  Very easygoing host and waitresses.  These days, one of my primary considerations is whether the place is kid friendly.  This Flying Biscuit is very good with kids.  And you can take them to Park Road Books after you eat to let them pick out a book.  However, keep in mind that the wait can be long at peak breakfast time.  So if you have kids, come early!  (Or there are other breakfast places in this strip mall, like Cafe Charlotte - not that great but will do if your kids are freaking out and the line here is too long - or Caribou - at least you can get a coffee and some juice for your kids).
Great breakfast, long wait but totally worth it. Down-home southern but organic options are awesome.

Although the menu advertises "southern" food there is no way these recipes are southern. If you like your biscuits really really dense with sugar on top and chicken gravy spread over them then you'll enjoy this oxymoron mix. Have never experienced in the south such a mixture of sugar and gravy. The chicken gravy was delicious but wasted on those biscuits. Also pay CLOSE attention to descriptions of their food. When they state creamy dreamy grits they really meant cream of wheat. So NOT southern. Guess their overall national success is based on the claim of southern and not the reality.   Service was good and friendly. No wait on a Friday evening. Eclectic environment. Prices are reasonable based on serving size if you enjoy their idea of southern.   Overall ashamed that people from other areas of the nation will consider this menu southern.  Before submitting this review did some research and found that Delia Champion founder and creator of those recipes grew up in New Jersey. If you want to try authentic southern food, visit Jestine's Kitchen in Charleston. So good there are no words.

I am a fan of Flying Biscuit! I have been here several times and have ordered both breakfast and dinner. I love the creamy grits served with breakfast. They are light, fluffy and full of buttery yumminess. I also love their tomato stoup (a cross between a soup and a stew). It has chopped onion pieces in it and lots of seasoning. It is by far the best tomato soup I've had in Charlotte. If I am feeling hungry but not sure what I'm in the mood for, I come here. It hits the spot every time.

Nothing special. I went for lunch on a weekday and the place was only half full yet they seemed short-staffed because 1) no one was at the front, so I wanted awhile before someone came and seated us, 2) all the waiters/waitresses were scrambling around with stoic looks on their faces with apparently no time to be friendly, 3) it took awhile for a waiter to come to our table. There was no friendly greeting, just a curt acknowledgement of my order and off she went. I think we exchanged less than 5 words the entire time.  Service was definitely lacking, and the food was equally disappointing. I miss the southern hospitality and delicious food of the Flying Biscuit in Atlanta.. At this Charlotte location, one side of my pancake was completely tough like cardboard. I tried, but I could only finish half my plate. Other reviewers seem to have had different experiences. Maybe they were having an off-day?

The food was just okay, everything I ordered for breakfast came out room temperature, from the eggs to the biscuits. Although the butter for the biscuits was good, but the actual biscuit was cold, as a result, the butter did not melt. The candied bacon was also cold so all of the grease penetrated into the bacon causing it to taste like grease and maple syrup. More than likely I will not return here during my next visit to Charlotte.

Terrible customer service.  I have ordered take out for breakfast 6 times from this place and was always satisfied until today.  I ordered their biscuit benedict.  Instead of receiving the poached eggs, bacon, hollandaise, and pimento cheese like the menu describes.... I got scrambled eggs, gravy, and jam.  When I called Foodie Call (the delivery service I used for the take out order) to let them know I got the wrong order he was very helpful and said he would get the right order delivered to me.  He then calls back to tell me the manager said she checked the order herself and that I got the right thing.  I explained again what I received and how it was different from what I ordered!  2 hours after I originally ordered my breakfast I got what I ordered! And the flying biscuit cafe had the nerve to ask for the wrong order back!!!! We will never be patrons of the flying biscuit again.  I don't mind a mistake but to go back and forth with a customer when the restaurant is wrong is inexcusable!

The flying biscuit is one of those places that you go to when you are in the mood for good southern food.  I have being to this restaurant a few times but it had always being for breakfast/brunch so this time my husband and I decided to go for dinner on a lazy Thursday night.  This day I was definitely in a comfort food mood, so I ordered the shrimp and grits and they were fantastic!  I love how creamy and luscious their grits are.  If you decide to order them, you won't be disappointed.  My husband ordered their version of a pot pie and it was very good.  Their biscuits are definitely to die for!

I created this account to post my first ever Yelp review because that's how good The Flying Biscuit is! A friend and I were hungry and trying to decide what to have for lunch today. On a whim, we stumbled across The Flying Biscuit. It was almost empty aside from a handful of customers. I knew right away just from the eclectic decor that we were in for a treat. Our server's name was Claudia. She was very nice and friendly and had our orders out in less than ten minutes. Granted, we went early on a Friday afternoon but for what it's worth, our food was so good I wouldn't have minded having to wait during their busy hours. My friend ordered the Turkey Hash and I ordered Pasta, Sausage and Eggs. We fell in love with our food! Rarely am I ever able to find a place on my very first visit where everything is delicious. The portions are more than generous and reasonably priced. We both took home half of everything. I tried some of her hash. The turkey was tender and perfectly seasoned. I've already decided it's what I'm going to order on my next visit. I was initially wary of a dish that mixes penne pasta and scrambled eggs but oddly enough, the combination works. The flavors of the spinach and chicken sausage and cheese and mushrooms were well-balanced to where not one ingredient overpowered the others. But far and away the best part of my meal: the creamy dreamy grits. Oh my gosh the grits! I'm not exaggerating when I say they are THE best grits I've ever had in my entire life. They're like crack in a bowl! I don't eat grits that often but when I do order them, I usually have to add salt, pepper, and butter to taste. Not this time. They were incredible! It would be worth it just to order a big bowl of creamy dreamy grits. They were so smooth and they melt in your mouth. One other component of the meal: the biscuits of course were great...light and fluffy. I'm convinced they've kidnapped someone's grandmother and is holding her hostage in the kitchen and the only thing she's allowed to do is make biscuits all day. Claudia directed us to a squeeze bottle of apple butter on our table for our biscuits. I usually cannot stand apple butter. It's gross and I hate the taste of it. I feel like something with the word apple in the name should at least taste like apples. I guess because everything else was so delicious, I thought "Why not?" and decided to try it anyway. I can now say the only apple butter I will ever eat is The Flying Biscuit's. I got a small cup of it to go with the other half of my biscuit that I took home. I love going to restaurants with inventive menus that don't serve the typical fare that you can get anywhere else. The Flying Biscuit is now one of my new favorite places to eat, hands down. I can't wait to go back!

The biscuits are okay, but everything else is phenomenal! I'm not even a huge grits person but they are amazing. I have no idea what they do to the grits to make them so good, but they are seriously the real deal. Service is fast (once you're seated) and breakfast is solid. But seriously, get the grits.
You are a breakfast restraunt. Learn how to cook an egg for gooness sakes. My eggs were brown and burned.

The atmosphere was great, the biscuits with the jam (I'm not a bread lover) was pretty good BUT do you know what turned me off...this dish I ordered that was supposed to be...I don't know what it was but it was eggs on the bottom with shredded beef on top. Least, to say complete turn off and I haven't been back since. The grits tasted like they were cooked in milk...wasn't a fan. I've had better brunch.
Great food as always. Sit in Travis' section! He's so nice and a great server.

The food made my mouth water like the Niagra Falls. The service was great!! I ordered half of their menu one time, and like a wild vulture from the African Plains, I devoured it all! After a while I took a 3pound crap at work and the bathroom was off limits  for  awhile. All in all, it was worth the brown volcano. Come here and try out all their great selections!!! This place is great!

I have eaten here several times. This time I had the Southern scramble.  It was pretty good. But I think the biscuit was a little too large and a little less tasty than I had hoped.  The grits were wonderful.  The place has a nice atmosphere for casual dining, and the wait staff tonight was excellent.  By comparison, their are better places for eggs. The flying biscuit will probably not be a place I will frequent for breakfast food fir supper very often  But they are unique and when I want to have good grits it's where I would go.

Great restaurant love the atmosphere and the food. We go here every year and hope that can continue for awhile. Love the quirky decor and cannot forget the delicious apple butter and biscuits. Best time of the year is when you can get the pineapple upside down pancakes :) so yummy!
Awesome!!! Yummy!!! Great variety and nice twist on Southern favorite!

This is an awesome place for all things breakfast. Sat outside the last time I went and for Sunday brunch didn't have to wait too long. Nice patio seating and extremely friendly host. Our server was attentive and friendly as well. Had what I consider the best thing on the menu called eggceptional eggs. Delicious over medium eggs over scrumptious black bean cakes. Comes with a side of really tasty and creamy grits. Definitely a go to spot for breakfast/brunch. I always get a side of their Applewood smoked pork bacon, which is delicious. Pretty reasonable prices as well.

So my husband and I are vegetarian; my parents are not.  We are always on the lookout for places we can all eat together and be happy.  Flying Biscuit, with one location near my house and my dad's office (Park Rd.) and one location near my parents' house (Ballantyne), has thus far fit the bill.  It gets two stars just for achieving that feat alone.  It gets another star for the wide variety of its menu, which includes all-day breakfast foods (all of which look pretty great) and plenty of veg-friendly options.  It gets a fourth star because when I ate there, I was served pretty decent food.  I ordered the black bean quesadilla, which was gigantic and melty and beany and covered with a really delicious chipotle sauce.  I'm eager to dive into their breakfast menu next time I visit; the range of options alone gives me great hope.  I do not, however, believe that I'll be a regular here, maybe because it's a little too... commercial-y?  It tries desperately to affect a whimsical, authentic decor, but it's all a little too shiny for my taste, and underneath the whimsy, I detect the movements of a business desperate for more franchises.  Not that that's always bad.  But, you know.

Service is usually great! Guillermo is the best server----fast, pleasant and totally ok with your special orders! Although its a chain you are treated like you are at a local place. Everything is so delicious! Creamy dreamy grits, cranberry apple butter and the Meggxican wrap are my favs!

The turkey sausage with grits, eggs, and biscuit are TDF!!! I get this almost once a week and the portion is so big I have plenty left over. My husband and kids fight over the leftovers!! Everything is delicious; even leftover. Sometimes I get two orders so I can bring more home. Still, they fight over every last morsel.

wow we did not know you could mess up pancakes.  The biscuits must have been made by Ellie Mae Clampett.  We have renamed this place now on our not to go ever list The Flying Brick.  The sweet tea was good.

Breakfast for dinner is always the right idea. Unfortunately tonight that proved to be the wrong decision. We have been to the Flying Biscuit many times before and have always enjoyed it. However, for a place that advertises "breakfast served all day" we were highly disappointed. Biscuits tasted as if they were held under a heat-lamp since the morning as did the moon dusted potatoes. Overall it just didn't taste fresh. Bummer.   On the way out we noticed they had an 88.5 score on their health inspection last week. Fare thee well Flying Biscuit. We'll be going to other fine establishments for our breakfast fix.

Simply put, my favorite place to eat breakfast in Charlotte. I always get the same thing, and that's the High Flyer. The eggs are perfectly cooked each time, and the oatmeal pancake with peaches and syrup? Yes.   My wife loves their grits, and we of course both enjoy the high rise biscuits (I, with copious amounts of the apple/cranberry butter). Recommended for a great breakfast spot.
Great place! Un restau super sympa. Proche de l'aéroport! Menu de petits déjeuners copieux, variés.  Une bonne adresse!
Family is from around these parts and are just back visiting. Everyone raved about the grits (a little salty for my taste) but good. Food good and service very friendly. Would recommend.
I'm not sure where the biscuit is flying to but mine landed in my tummy.  It was good with the apple butter sauce.  The grits are the best ever.  I'll be back to this cafe for certain.

Sometimes I wish we could rate in 1/2 star increments, because the food and overall experience was a 3, while the server we had made it a 4.   Flying Biscuit is a chain, but has a nice homey feel with the murals on the walls and purple, and bright colored decor. It just screams "neighborhood and family".  When you have a restaurant with the word BISCUIT in the name, I'd expect a big flaky, moist biscuit with a buttery golden outside.  Instead, their biscuits are white and dense like Bisquick dollop biscuits. It's fine...but the redeeming factor is the cranberry-apple butter that comes in a squeeze bottle on your table.   I had the grits since THREE people recommended it to me-- and yes, it indeed buttery and cheesy and super seasoned and bursting with flavor.  Though it was so rich, I felt bloated and gross afterward.  I suggest using willpower to stop eating after your full...but it's hard since this dish is so mouth watering.  My husband got the fried green tomato sandwich which was delicious, but INSANELY rich with bacon and I believe cheese too.  It was too greasy for his taste, and too made him feel too bloated.   Our server was really great about keeping our ice teas coming, and any condiments we needed.  Overall, I'd come back again, but probably would order different items.
Service is friendly and attentive. The BBQ tofu burrito is the F'n Bomb! I'll def be back to try out their other vegan options. The bar is HIGH!
The grits are worth the trip. Everything else is quality, but the grits are the real treat. We usually go there every other Sunday morning.

Great food, and the service is quick and attentive. I love the Biscuit Eggs and Gravy, but the biscuits by themselves are just ok. They aren't a traditional kind of southern biscuit, but still kind of good. The rest of the breakfast menu is amazing. And, a surprise menu option that's great is the fish tacos. Who would have thought this place would kill it wish some fish tacos!! The shrimp and Grits is also worth a try. Hell, it's all worth a try.

I think this place is overrated. Yes, the biscuits are to die for. They do have a lot of nice menu options and are considerate of different diets. But I think there is a lot of hype over this place because there aren't enough "alternative" diet restaurants in the area. If you have ever lived in Boone or Asheville, then you know that there are loads of "alternative" restaurants, constantly having to strive to be their best in order to compete. My family has gone to the flying biscuit every once in a while for years, and I don't think the menu has ever changed. Also, the place is way too small, the wait is generally way too long, the tables are cramped, and it is usually very noisy.   Also, either last year or the year before an employee was murdered by another employee in the kitchen. It made my stomach turn that they didn't move locations. It was also revealed that they hadn't bothered to run a background check on the murderer (who had a criminal record), so that didn't sit well with me either.

Underwhelmed. While the menu options were extensive, husband and I agreed our kid's chocolate chip pancakes were the best-tasting of our meals. Service was sub-par. Our waitress wasn't warm or welcoming, and the kid's food took a long time and was the last to come out (had to send our meals back to keep them warm while we waited).  Despite the long wait, the kid's order was wrong and our waitress was quick to blame the kitchen. Meh...
So good! I had the black bean quesadilla and it was bomb! Great service and super cute environment. Good prices too!

Our server was excellent. She explained the items and substitutions options perfectly. The southern eggs biscuit Benedict with chicken sausage was amazing. Eggs poached perfectly. The pimento cheese had just  hint of spice. I highly recommend it.  The grits were the best I have ever had. The were seasoned just right. This was the first time I've had grits out and didn't have to add something to them.

We came in a Friday afternoon , we didn't had lunch so we were starving. We had the Blackened Shrimp and Grits and Southern Benedict eggs on biscuit and potatoes. The cheese on the eggs Benedict was not melted all the way through. The potatoes came out cold and old , and we hate to think they were leftovers from breakfast ! The biscuits were cold and hard ..worst biscuits ever. You think when you name your restaurant biscuit they would be great! Totally disappointed with this place.

Excellent service and grits were super creamy.  I am not an expert in grits but I did like them. Had the southern scramble eggs. were not very fluffy nor did they have much collards. Biscuits were tasty and not too heavy.

Great food!  Their menu offers your good ole country food and also a lot of healthy food!  It's a win-win for everyone!  I went for lunch and had their Devils Burger (veggie burger with spicy stuff) and it was delish!  Also, their biscuits are comparable to the famous LoveLess Cafe in Nashville, TN!

I am Australian and on the adventure of a lifetime in the Northern Hemisphere and have always been intrigued by southern cuisine. So during my stay in Charlotte I have been on a mission to sample everything southern I can get my hands on. Biscuits and Gravy oh my did I come to understand what all the fuss is about and grits too. I explained my southern food desire to the waiter who was more than happy to guide me in the right direction and serve me up a meal to remember. Highly highly highly recommended.

Very bland food and terrible service. Everything had a terrible after taste and tasted like it was sitting awhile. The waitress only checked in twice, to get my order and serve my food. Not the best breakfast place.

I'm into flying biscuit.  The tasty breakfast I had hit the spot and I can't wait to go back.  I enjoyed the Meggsxican wrap and a side of grits.  The meal also came with a fluffy biscuit and same cranberry apple butter.  Service was good, even though we had a large party.  The decor is very bright and cheery.  They have a nice patio out back which I highly recommend.  For most of the breakfast dishes you'll end up paying about $8-10.  Pretty reasonable for deliciousness.
You can't go wrong with this place. Definitely worth the wait. I wish there were more locations around the city. :)

We are visiting from out of town and stumbled across the Flying Biscuit Cafe. The food was reasonably priced and original. From the vegan love cakes to the shrimp and grits, from the salmon scramble to the gravy biscuit, it was all delicious. This place has a little something for everyone and is build on loads of personality!!

Loved this place! The shrimp and grits were delicious. The service was speedy and very polite. The location was nice; surrounded by other nice shops and eateries and near the airport. Would definitely go again.
First off, the grits get an A+!!! Now, I also enjoyed the turkey hash. It was a flavorfest!!! And who'd have thunk it - it was tender, juicy and melt in your mouth good!

This edition of Excited about Eating takes us to a "Southern-inspired" comfort food restaurant, The Flying Biscuit Cafe. Located in the Park Road area of Charlotte, this popular meeting spot features breakfast all day plus salads, sandwiches, and plate meals.  Dora here. Unlike last week's choice, I knew The Flying Biscuit Cafe would be a great experience. A couple weeks ago, we stopped here, but the crowd outside and the corresponding long wait deterred us. This week we strategically timed our visit, hoping to fall sometime after the breakfast crowd and before lunch. And, also unlike last week, our server seemed to really love her job. She was knowledgeable, helpful with suggestions, and stopped by our table several times to check on us and refill our drinks, always with a smile even though they were obviously super busy. Don't let the skinny exterior deceive you. This cafe goes a long ways back with another outdoor patio in the rear.  For a starter, we ordered a side of Grilled Macaroni and Cheese that Yelpers rave about. This mac and cheese is nothing like I have ever tasted. Rectangle blocks of mac and cheese grilled to perfection, somewhat crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Dora here. This alone was worth the drive. Fluffy, light, you don't really even taste the pasta. The texture comes off more like a souffle. HEAVENLY!  For my lunch (breakfast), I chose the Egg-Stravaganza. Two poached eggs, chicken sausage, turkey bacon, grits and whole wheat French toast topped with raspberry sauce and a honey cream. This dish was outstanding, eggs cooked to the exact time and consistency, grits were creamy and cheesy. The French toast wasn't overly egg-y or thick, almost tasted like pumpernickel bread, so I was surprised to find out it was actually wheat bread. Whatever the type, the sauce and cream were a great accompaniment.  Dora here. Y'all, check out the Very Berry Chicken Wrap. Doesn't it look refreshing? It was!! Great texture from the candied walnuts, fresh flavors, light on the raspberry vinaigrette, loaded with chunky chicken, delish! The perfect choice for a hot summer afternoon, I would definitely order this again. Maybe not the Garlic and Basil Mashed Potatoes because I prefer my taters a bit creamier.  What about you? How do you prefer your French Toast? Or not a fan at all? We'd love to know! Ernie and Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies http://bit.ly/2sGP7Jj

The service was great but unfortunatley me nor my husband liked the food. I got the egg-stravaganza. The grits were good but the french toast was dry and hard, the biscut was more like a scone. My husband had the meal that had the bean patty, sour cream, feta cheese and eggs over easy. With biscut and gravy(cant remember the name). The gravy tasted like stuffing and the main course had alot of flavor but they didnt complement eachother. The coffee was good. I will give this place another try. Ill just get somthing different.
Great breakfast! Biscuits with apple butter were delicious!!!! Smoked Salmon scramble was terrific.

After a tiny wait, we were seated in the back. This place might look small but it's huge! Adorably fun, kitschy decor with friendly service. I made a totally random plate of egg whites, fruit, potatoes and an oatmeal pancake. My mother got sausage gravy biscuits w/ eggs an grits. We need to talk about the grits. I mean, wow these things are fantastic! The biscuits are dusted with sugar that compliments them perfectly. The egg was perfect, fruit was fresh and th potatoes were delicious. My favorite part was the oatmeal pancake. The warm peach compote it came with was delicious as well. The cake is dense and chewy, sweet and filling. For it being extremely busy, our order came out quickly and without any error. Will definitely be back!

I just love this place. I'll wait 20 minutes I'm the cold to get a table inside and eat a good breakfast. I'm a simple girl - eggs, potatoes, grits, fruit. They ALWAYS deliver the best food with great flavor. I'm basically licking the plate when I'm done. The potatoes have herbs on them and it's so yummy! Of course, the food comes with a biscuit which is very unique to this restaurant. Very fresh and doughy. Mm-mm.  Staff is friendly and efficient so the wait moves quick.

This is my go to breakfast in Charlotte. I love the menu and I try to try something new all the time. My latest visit was lunch (Yay me, I tried something new!) and I got a sandwich with lettuce, bacon, cheese, tomato, delicious white sauce and egg on a whole wheat bun with a side of 3 grilled mac and cheese bites. Huge sandwich! Grilled Mac and cheese bites were so creamy, greasy and totally delicious.   Staff is always on point and food is consistent.  It's always packed, especially weekend mornings but the wait doesn't last long and there are a few tables outside that are sometimes available to sit at or watch other people eat their food.  I also recommend the Creamy grits, eggs, pancakes, and of course the famous biscuit!

Made the weekly visit to the Biscuit. It seldom disappoints, but would have to say the sandwich special this evening just a C+. The "California Chicken" sandwich was good, just not special. It was as advertised... chicken with Swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce and tomato on a wheat bun... and that was it. Good, just not great. Had to add some Cholula to give it a little flavor. With all sauces to be had at such a culinary workshop, I expected a little more. Oh well, it won't stop us from going back.

My family and I went there .....several times. My husband had the sausage gravy over biscuits with grits and it was awesome!  Love the side of love dish too.  And our son is a big, big fan of the french toast sticks.

I can't believe I've been in Charlotte for two years and hadn't been here yet. I had the combo with the raspberry French toast. I was little skeptical when it came out looking like thinly sliced wheat toast with jam, but man was that amazing. The honey-vanilla glaze added a little extra oomph without being overly sweet.   I wasn't a fan of the biscuits. I think part of it was because they were so dense and everything else on my plate was so delicious.  I can't wait to go back.
This place does breakfast right. I haven't had a better biscuits and gravy and their grits were on point.  I really liked the different grits bowl options too.

Food was fantastic, server was great too. We ordered the fried green tomatoes and I wasn't horribly impressed with those, but my veggie omelet was great even after it was reheated! I'm surprised the biscuit I got wasn't good since that is their name, but overall cute place and I will be going back. Seriously though do not eat a biscuit without a drink... It's desert city.

Parking was easy and no wait for a table on a weekday morning. The decor is fun, and the employees were pleasant and attentive. My husband and I loved our omelets, great menu options for vegetarians. We will definitely be back.

I arrived at The Flying Biscuit Cafe at 7:30 to check out their breakfast. This place is so freaking cute. It is very colorful and it has just the right amount of things on the wall too look at. The interior is tastefully offbeat and a great way to start your morning.   I ordered the Egg-Stravaganza which included "two eggs served with our chicken sausage, crisp turkey bacon, creamy dreamy grits, plus whole wheat French toast topped with homemade raspberry sauce and honey creme anglaise." So freaking good. My food came out very fast. Less than 5 minutes and everything was sitting in front of me. The creamy dreamy grits are no joke! They have a great amount of cheese in them and are truly creamy. There wasn't a single lump. French toast was very good and I loved the raspberry and honey creme sauce.  Don't forget to try the apple butter that is already set on the table. It goes great with the hot biscuits. Really great place. Can't wait to come back on my next visit to Charlotte.

Today's server wasn't observant or friendly. Instead of asking to take our order, he just said ok ladies first. First for what?   I ordered one of the specials for the week and it comes with a side. He didn't ask me what I wanted. After he took my bf order, I asked him doesn't my order come with a side? I guess he remembered it did so he named 3 I could have. This is not how FB rolls. My dish also came in wrap form that I didn't like so i just scooped it out and ate it. Our server made no mention of any specials, didn't refill our drinks,  and didn't ask us how was our food...even with the big wrap bread empty on the plate.

The menu is fun and creative. Service was horrible! My boyfriend and I went in for lunch. We were greeted with a disgruntled hostess/server. She showed us to a table, slammed the menus down and walked off. Five minutes later she came back to take our drink order. Mumbling and acting as if we were an inconvenience to her day. I have waited tables over the years. I couldn't believe her body language and attitude. I ordered the Southern Style Biscuit Benedict. It was delicious! The combination of pimento cheese, poached eggs, and hollandaise sauce was perfection. Much to my surprise, considering their name, the biscuit was very dry and hard. I was very hesitant to send it back considering our server's foul mood.The decor is fun and the location is great. I'm not sure if I would go back. There are just too many places in Charlotte that offers up similar fare with much better service.

Well, we have been here quite a few times and have liked it in the past. It's a cool place with great atmosphere and we have liked the food. However, we have noticed a decline in quality. You risk getting a biscuit that was made yesterday and hard as a rock. Today we got pancakes from who knows when. They were definitely not fresh, barely warm and stale...and 3 stale pancakes, 1 biscuit.... no sides $9.00!!!..where's the fun in that. On a plus side, they have the best grits.

One of the best breakfasts on the road I've ever had; hands down. Full dining room, but managed to squeeze into a seat at the breakfast bar. Ordered the shrimp scramble special, with the dreamy grits and biscuit.   I eat bug for breakfast, and this filled me up, along with the the speedy refills on coffee. Guillermo was working the bar like a top notch pro, and everyone was quickly tended to. My food was served in under 10 minutes. 3 eggs, shrimp, feta, turkey bacon, tomatoes, some kind of awesome salsa; yeah, this breakfast was the bomb.   Creamy dreamy grits and a biscuit are standard sides, but buy an extra dozen to take home for breakfast the next day. Apple butter in squeeze bottles on the bar...eat that stuff with a spoon if I had to.   If you are within 10 miles of this place and need breakfast, drive past the IHOP's and Denny's, and cruise on into the Flying Biscuit. Lots of parking, great atmosphere, attentive and well trained staff, oh....and the food is all that and then some.

Hands down best grits I've ever had in my entire life. Words can't even do them justice. Their biscuits are delicious as well- make sure to enjoy them with the apple butter spread on each table. A great brunch spot in Charlotte I highly recommend!

Been here about 4 times with friends out of their choosing. I've tried something different every time and have never been impressed. The salad was the best thing I had there and some of the spinach was wilted and old in it.  Like others said, the biscuits are awful. There are so many better breakfast spots in charlotte, and just go to bojangles for a good biscuit.
Friendly staff. Clean establishment.  French toast wheat is... strange. Chicken Sausage is made for pepper lovers.  Next time I'll try something else...

This is a cute place, kitschy almost. That diner/down on the farm decor.  We came at an odd time, like 3 in the afternoon, and there were quite a few people there.  I was craving pancakes, so yay for breakfast all day!   The coffee was decent, nothing to write home about but not sludge.  My blueberry pancakes were on the sweet side as pancakes go.  Another nice thing was the advertised availability of local and natural offerings. Biscuits were... kind of hard.  That spoiled the mood a bit.  Considering the place is named for them.  Guess at an off time, we got off biscuits.

Would have given this place five stars if not for the biscuits. We visited on a busy Sunday but the service was quick and friendly. This was our first visit, based on a friend's recommendation, and we really liked the diverse choices on the breakfast menu. Eggs were cooked perfectly, I loved the moon dusted potatoes which I substituted for the creamy dreamy grits. My hubby had those and said they were as heavenly as described. I really enjoyed the eggs over black bean cakes with feta, tomatillo and sour cream. Would def order that again! Coffee was hot, fresh and good. Love the funky decor, it seemed like a popular local hangout. So...the biscuits? Well, we love us some good southern biscuits, and for a place with biscuit in the name, we were just disappointed. They were kinda sweet, and a little dry. Don't let that stop you though, overall a great breakfast find.
They should seriously market the sausage and gravy. You may hear chicken sausage but - good Lord this is some amazing sausage biscuits and gravy.

This place has great food and a nice atmosphere. Everything is very vibrant and colorful... And don't worry, there aren't really biscuits flying towards your head! I had the bacon and cheddar chicken sandwich. It had a good flavor and texture. The potatoes that came with it had a good combo of spices, but they could have been crispier. Tilapia was flaky and well cooked, and the shrimp had a nice zingy spice to it. Didn't try the grits as I don't care for them (it's a textural thing), but family members liked them- said they had a fair about of salt and garlic. Now for one of my favorite parts. One of their specialities is grilled mac& cheese, and it was really good! Had a good crisp with plenty of traditional mac&cheese flavor- you have to try it! Finally, what you've all been waiting for, THE  BISCUITS!  So , let's start with the inside. Fluffy, airy, soft, other various synonyms.. just pull off little pieces and let them melt in your mouth. Now the outside- crispy and crunch with the tops dusted with sugar! Yum! The sugar goes perfect with savory other foods like grits and potatoes. They offer apple butter which my family members liked, but I thought they were good as is. Next time I want to try their breakfast selection, but diffidently good for anytime of day! I'd give them 4 1/2 stars, only problem is that the seats were dirty and we had to wait for a little bit to be seated even though we got there early and they weren't busy.
AMAZING FOOD!!! The biscuits are melt in your mouth good and the service is great. I would highly recommend breakfast here!
Great food, good prices, fast service. Everything was perfect. Always super busy on weekends, but not weekdays.

This place was somehow off my radar for a long time. I think maybe I assumed they were a breakfast only place, but they are breakfast and much more! The menu is quite expansive but not expensive, and everything sounded delicious. I ended up ordering their turkey meatloaf with mashed potatoes (real) and some of the best green beans I have ever had! Oh, and the meal comes with a biscuit with delicious pineapple jelly!  Service was excellent from Monique, and she was always there at just the right time with a drink refill and to check on me. I can't wait to go back and sample more of the menu.

I look forward coming to the Flying Biscuit while visiting Charlotte.  Their food is great and the service friendly.   Their specials are worth a try.  I was here for breakfast and ordered the Flying Biscuit breakfast.  Check out the breakfast menu as there is a variety of choices.   I have heard that the Fried Green Tomato BLT is very good and I plan on ordering it next time when in Charlotte.
Good for families and kids, but the whole wheat French Toast was like cardboard. I prefer biscuits that are more moist, and potatoes that are pan roasted so they are hot and crispy.

I LOVE breakfast food and thanks to yelpers posting pictures from this place, I knew I had to try it. I was in the mood for some biscuits and gravy so I ordered this, Got my eggs over easy and sub'd the grits for potatoes. An awesome portion of food and great presentation. I forked my first bite, watching the yolk spill over the biscuits and under the gravy. :) I'm a fan!  We went around 10am on a Sunday and they Just started a waiting list. I was the second but got seated in a minute. They have PLENTY of room. We sat in their back patio which I didn't even know they had. Very nice. Our service was wonderful. I can't wait to pay another visit.

Flying Biscuit Cafe is a favorite of my wife's, who goes there for lunch with work friends. We happened to be at the movies this afternoon and decided to stop over for an early dinner.  FBC is a great, feel-good meal spot - any meal! They serve some of the best biscuits in Charlotte - and that is really saying something. The salads are awesome - I had the BLT with goat cheese. The tomato basil soup was very hearty.   But the star here is the biscuit and apple butter. We were given more than enough to take a few home, thanks to the manager who waited on us.   High marks, across the board.

We had heard so many great things about Flying Biscuit, so when we got a Groupon for it, we had to try it.  Boy were we dissapointed.  We didn't have 1 good thing.  The fried green tomatoes were soggy and bland.  The Biscuits were by far the worst i've had at a commercial restaurant.  It was embarrasing, especially given the name of the place.  I had a dish (forgot the name) with potatoes, roast and eggs.  The potatoes were stale, and moderately cold.    We were so dissapointed since the place was very kid friendly and should have been a home run.

YUM YUM YUM! Came here during our visit to Charlotte and some fellow yelpers recommended it.... I am SO glad they did. We did have to wait 30 minutes because we went during Sunday brunch time, but it was totally worth the wait. I ordered the southern style biscuit benedict and it was perfect. It was a biscuit topped with pimento cheese, two poached eggs and bacon (they let you choose between regular or turkey). They top it with hollandaise sauce and garnish with fresh basil. FANTASTIC. Kind of wish they opened a location closer to me. The staff is also super friendly. Also, try their coffee porter, its really good.
Definitely my favorite breakfast spot in Charlotte! The Grits are AMAZING!

What a fantastic place! Service is excellent and I tried the grits which I thought I would not like but O M G those dreamy and creamy grits are everything! Now i'm second guessing my life choices about grits.. do I like grits?? lol.. Amaze!!

An awesome experience while visiting family.  80's music, tofu scramble, great coffee, and super efficient service and fun vibe.  My daughter got the EggStravaganza which is a great dish with a little bit of everything.  pro-tip: they sell their t-shirts.

Stopped by this morning for breakfast. Place was very slow, but considering it was after the weekday breakfast rush, it's understandable. I'm sure it's packed on the weekend. Ordered the High Flyer, which came with eggs, chicken sausage, grits and a biscuit. Also came with an oatmeal pancake on the side. Was surprised by the food. All this for $8.75...great price I thought. Grits were AWESOME and the biscuit was warm and soft. The pancake was a little dense for me, but had a good flavor in the couple bites I had. Service was attentive and cheerful. All and all a great meal and I recommend the joint.

Having never been to Flying Biscuit for anything other than breakfast, we decided to go for dinner this past weekend to see what else was on the organic/vegetarian menu.  It wasn't very crowded, and by the end of the meal, we could tell why.    The food was okay, but nothing to write home about.  I ordered the Fried Green Tomato BLT sandwich.  It sounded yummy!  What it was was three thin half dollar-sized slices of tomato on a rather bland hamburger bun.  I really didn't taste much of anything other than the bun and a smidge of goat cheese.  The cashew-jalapeno relish was delicious, but it all fell off.  It really should have featured at least a couple of big chunky tomato slices.  My partner's "flat iron steak grilled to medium rare"  included with his Steak and Eggs was pretty small and pretty medium well.    I guess we'll stick to breakfast time only at Flying Biscuit.  Maybe that's why they serve breakfast all day?

Great place to take the family. Also, they have Kids Eat Free on Wednesday nights. We are happy to add this restaurant to our breakfast rotations. You have to get there early on Sunday in order to decrease your wait time.   My son ordered the French Toast and  when it came, I wasn't sure if he would eat it since it was clearly very whole grain. He scarfed it down in no time. The kids loved the hot chocolate too.  Nice addition to Charlotte. Glad they are here but wish they were a little closer!

The Flying Biscuit is very much worth the wait (because waiting in line is the norm for this place). I have not met a plate that wasn't outstanding.  The staff is really good and the atmosphere is easy going. The Biscuit has great hotcakes, various egg dishes and killer sausage gravy. Run,jump, or fly to get there.

AMAZING! We came for Mothers Day and surprisingly didn't have to wait for a table. The atmosphere was cool and the food was delicious! I got the veggie scramble with fruit and it also comes with the classic biscuit (which is amazing with the apple butter). I got a side of the moon dusted potatoes as well which were seasoned so well! Other people at my table got the eggs Benedict which were apparently amazing. It was all amazing.

Very good breakfast but host asking people waiting in the cold to tell their server if they had coffee while waiting is a bit much - come on 5 cent coffee while you wait in the cold should be on the house - a big turn-off
I was bringing my daughter to the airport from Durham. We met  my other daughter who lives in Charlotte for breakfast. The menu and the service was awesome! Very tasty!

NOMnomNOMnomNOM.  This place is really popular and for good reason, so expect to wait for a table upon arrival.  It's really one of the few hipster places to get good quality breakfast food after sleeping in.  You'll have a hard time choosing what to eat cause everything sounds so good. To no surprise, it tastes even better than it sounds because you're very very hungry :)

I come from a long line of breakfast lovers and inkeepers, so I am always on the hunt for a fulfilling, delicious, fresh breakfast. Honestly I'm always trying to find a replacement for my beloved Hobee's  in the SF Bay Area, with no avail.  Well Flying Biscuit is certainly popular in the QC and has a large number of tables.  As someone else put, it has a colorful and fun interior.   The menu has several egg options but for some reason or another I really only saw 1 or 2 I would eat. One time the veggie scramble was awesome, the last time it had a funky taste. Their Shrimp & Grits was 5/5 awesome because their "creamy dreamy grits" are appropriately named. I ate myself sick in fact. The first time I went I was so excited to see organic oatmeal pancakes with peaches, as I always make it a tradition to have Cracker Barrel's freestone peach pancakes after triathlons and I always try and eat organic. Alas, they were such a disappointment and I had to scrape off the nasty peaches. The Stud didn't believe me until he tried it.   That said, they totally redeemed themselves with their chocolate chip pancakes that are to DIE for- 5/5 perfectly fluffy but with a nice hard edge to them (trust me). Wow.  Their "signature" chicken sausage is really disappointing. We have Aidell's Chicken Apple sausage from Costco every weekend and Flying Biscuits' sausage can't even come close to comparing. Dry and meh.  Here's the confusing part- the biscuits, after which the restaurant is named is not the best part of the meal. They are indeed a bit hard (even at peak times) and they have a nice flavor but are definitely not soaked in lard so they tend to be a bit dry. They seem NOT to be southern style which is odd.   Eh?  Coffee is OK, OJ is OK, peach nectar is delish.  Service is average.  So as you can see, some things are GREAT, and some things are meh.  To people that don't have such high breakfast standards, it's probably great. To me, the search continues...  Tip: Check in on Foursquare and get free OJ or dessert.

A must for brunch in Charlotte. They are always good about gluten-free items. Only downside is there can be a wait on the weekends. The creamy dreamy grits are a must!  Favorite meal: Hollywood omelette.
Delicious brunch or lunch spot and I always love their featured cocktail, but don't come here if you're in a hurry. They are always packed on weekends and the service is slow.
The food is ok at best and extremely heavy don't waste your time hare and go to little spoon instead which is very close

I recently discovered The Flying Biscuit Cafe through the ordering and food delivery service Foodie Call. I love trying new restaurants, and anybody that serves breakfast from morning til night is a winner in my book! That said however, just as a disclaimer: I've never actually been directly on location so I can't comment about their whereabouts, staff or service in general. I can however say anytime I've called ahead of ordering through Foodie to ask about any ingredients used, they have been more than willing to go look up anything I asked about, due to family food allergies.  As for their food though, everything I've had so far has been absolutely delicious! If you're looking for details on individual items, continue reading, otherwise, just stop here and know that The Flying Biscuit is great place to grab a good hot plate of food.   1) Their "Spicy Shrimp Quesadilla" is exactly as described, sauteed shrimp, white cheddar cheese, and lots of serrano peppers sandwiched in a flower tortilla. They don't scrimp on the shrimp or the peppers either, and when they say spicy they mean business!  2) The "Blackened Tilapia" is fresh tasting and seasoned well. It's usually served over their "Creamy Dreamy Grits" and topped with spicy herb marinara sauce. It comes with a side of spicy southern collard greens, which I've also ordered as a singular side dish. They're good, but not as spicy as I had expected, and not quite how I remember traditional greens being served, (a few too many stems) but a nice flavor just the same.  3) Their "Egg-Stravaganza" plate is great. You get two eggs any way you could enjoy them, chicken sausage, two slices of turkey bacon and their creamy dreamy grits. It also comes with a side of toast, and their homemade raspberry and honey creme anglaise sauces. The raspberry sauce is to die for, I mean really, it's that good! The eggs are always fresh, the chicken sausage while a bit of a different texture from the pork sausage that I'm used to is still spiced to perfection. They offer an option to substitute sides in and out on most of their menu items, so if turkey bacon isn't your thing you can always get pork bacon. Either way, it's a lot of food for one plate, and it's very filling.  4) The "Pasta, Sausage and Eggs" plate is probably an acquired taste, but I enjoyed it. You get three eggs, scrambled up with chicken sausage, spinach, mushrooms, penne pasta, covered in cheddar cheese and it's served with a side of their grits. The flavors of everything worked well together, but the texture was odd due to I'm assuming the grain of the penne pasta alongside the chicken sausage.  5) Their biscuits are always fluffy, and the apple butter they serve with it has a nice spice to it. 6) Their grits have a wonderful flavor and consistency, probably some of the best I've ever had from a restaurant. 7) Their seasonal fruit has always been fresh. 8) Their yogurt parfait with granola and strawberries is always a light and yummy treat.  9) The grilled macaroni and cheese is a favorite of everybody in my family, especially my daughter. I won't lie, those little crispy cheese edges are scrumptious. 10) Their blueberry pancakes are delicious, very fresh tasting, always fluffy. 11) Their "Love Cakes" were a little dry for my taste, but overall still pretty tasty.  12) Their Organic Oatmeal Pancakes are exactly what you think, oatmeal pancakes and it's our favorite item on the menu. They're topped with peach compote but we actually use the previously mentioned raspberry sauce on ours (or even the apple butter on occasion) and ask for the compote on the side, it makes for an amazing breakfast (or breakfast for dinner) and coupled with any of their various sides listed above, you seriously can't go wrong.  I look forward to trying more of their dishes, and continuing to enjoy all that I've had thus far. I was made aware about a month ago (May/June 2014) that they've been making some menu changes, so there are probably even more goodies at their actual locale to try, devour and deem delicious. Enjoy!
Best grits I've had at an establishment EVER. Omg...I can't even describe them. The biscuits are absolutely delicious and as far as entrees, trust me, get the Southern Scramble!

I am breakfast and brunch super fan, and make sure to stop by anywhere that has excellent offerings. I stumbled upon flying biscuit years ago when I attended UF and they had a location over there. Through the years I have attended several locations in their home state of Georgia. I have had pleasurable dining experiences for the most part.  The location is Charlotte is conveniently in a nicer strip mall with plenty of parking. I came here just when they opened for a nice hot breakfast instead of paying for the hotel's ludicrous breakfast buffet. I had a coffee, which I did not enjoy. The roast is not great  I ordered the southern scramble with a whole wheat biscuit. As others have said, the biscuit had an overly flour taste that ruined my biscuit experience. The eggs were tasty but a bit salty. The best part of my breakfast were the grits.  Will return but may try something else.

A great add for Park Road Shopping Center. Free coffee on Sunday while you wait in the brunch line. Pretty good service. There is a patio for nice days, though not much of a view. The food is great... still not sure why the biscuits are the signature 'thing' but otherwise the menu is solid. Now they need to take one Uptown!

Great place for brunch! I have been to the ones in Atlanta and loved it there too. I am not a fan of grits but the people I was with proclaimed them as "the best damn grits", so that must mean they're tasty! The biscuits were flaky and the apple butter on the table was delicious. Food came out quick and service was great! Would definitely return!

Flying Biscuit is synonymous with brunch in queen city and for a good reason. Both times I have been here we've been lucky enough to not have to wait and have always been greeted with great service. One huge downside in my opinion, they don't have a liquor license. No Bloody's, Mimosas or spiked espressos here, folk. Unfortunately, I've forgotten this tidbit and have been disappointed upon arrival twice.  Moving on, the food is great and they have a menu that caters to those looking to indulge in an artery-clogging 3000 calorie meal and for those that are looking for something a little lighter. I love this mix of traditional and a little more out-of-box options.  Oatmeal pancakes were scrumptious. Fluffy and hearty but light enough that I didn't feel like I needed to be rolled out of the place. The creamy dreamy grits are appropriately named and the whole wheat french toast was impressive as well. The only thing I wasn't excited about were the moon dusted potatoes which are cubed too large and not crispy enough for my subjective taste.  Personally, I prefer the biscuits at Tupelo Honey.... yes, yes I know. But overall this place is A-Ok. Need to return and get the fried green tomato BLT soon!

Woke up the afternoon after a road trip adventure craving brunch - late evening brunch... okay, hungover breakfast for dinner at 7:30 pm, whatever. Found the space deserted, but this was probably attributed to the dismal and chilly rain.   Our server was kind and attentive, but that wasn't enough to erase some of the not so cool cons: although the fried green tomato appetizer was delicious, it was ridiculously overpriced - 7 bones for 4 tomato slices? come again?; the Southern Scramble was more of a Southern trainwreck... soggy, slightly bitter and the turkey bacon bits looked suspiciously like, well, bacon bits; above all though, the "Orange Scented French Toast" was the ultimate abomination - forget that jive on the menu, this was two pieces of soggy wheat bread drizzled with raspberry preserves and vanilla syrup. Yum?  Everything tasted decent and it's always nice to be able to get breakfast day or night, I love the apple butter and the fact that I never leave Flying Biscuit feeling bloated or overstuffed. I can only hope the presentation and quality is a little smoother the next time I stop in. And that they won't be playing Nickelback this time either.
The food was great and the prices were reasonable! The wait staff was very friendly and efficient. The atmosphere is exciting and charming.  Looking forward to dining here again.

As far as a breakfast place can go this place reaches the peak of service and quality.   I came here with a friend to grab lunch at somewhere new because we normally go to Chick Fil A across the street. Being limited on time we need somewhere we can be in an out in half an hour.   I got there first after unsuccessfully navigating the parking lot (it can be confusing), and was seated in a booth near the back. The waitress came up and asked what I would like to drink. Knowing what we both wanted to eat I ordered our food as well.   I don't think it took 5 minutes to get our food. Right as my friend sat down it was coming out of the kitchen and being placed on the table. It was wonderful. I got the biscuits and gravy. It's chicken gravy, so I was a little hesitant, but the texture is that of sausage and it was very good! The biscuit is dense and you only really need one biscuit. I couldn't even finish that. You can get just the biscuit or you can get it with eggs and grits. The waitress kindly told me that they were big biscuits, so I just went with that and I'm glad she did.   Since I didn't see the biscuits and gravy on the menu I didn't know how much they cost, but I wasn't worried because they are not usually expensive. When I got the bill, I was surprised. Only $2.99! What a deal! Not only was it cheaper than Chick Fil A it was faster too! We will definitely be back here, I think this is our new lunch spot.

WHAT in the world was I thinking?!?!? And why did it take me so long to have their brunch?!?  My friend and I stopped in for a late brunch Sunday afternoon, we had a small wait for a table but I got VIP parking right on front of the restaurant so we just chatted and waited in the car until they called us in.   Not long after we were seated our waiter arrived, very pleasant smile and attitude it was like we were old friends. He took our drink orders and offered tons of suggestions. Based on previous reviews, I already knew what I wanted to try...the Pasta, Sausage, and Eggs which is three eggs with chicken sausage, penne pasta, spinach, and cheese...(thanks JJ! ) I decided to skip the mushrooms this visit but they normally come with this dish as well.  As I my side I decided to change the grits for the hash browns. My friend ordered the salmon scramble with grits and a side of bacon.  Even though, it was packed it took no time me my food was awesome!!!!   My food was delicious!!! The mix of pasta, chicken sausage and eggs was so unique I just loved it! Just an overall hearty and tasty dish. The hash browns were very tasty but my friend let me try her grits and I could have kicked myself for not ordering them!!! They really were creamy and dreamy!!! Sooo much better than I expected. I tried to keep my spoon out of her dish but I couldn't...next time TRUST that I will be getting the grits!!!  Fabulous meal, great service and just overall excellent experience! Loved it and can't wait to come back!!!

I initially wanted to try out this restaurant because I thought the name of it was fun and I like biscuits. So I tried it out with my family. After enduring a very long wait, I thought that the wait must have been because the food was just that good.
