The restaurant is pretty cramped and while there is outdoor seating, it felt like it was understaffed. Rushing around and trying to keep up, created a very brisk and unfriendly service. As for the food, it was plain and predictable for a breakfast place. Nothing memorable and most disappointing of all, the biscuits were not that good. We have not gone back.

Came here with a girlfriend for brunch one Saturday.   Service = Friendly and quick. Hostess and waitress extremely friendly especially for 9:30 in the AM. Not crowded yet, but I hear at 10:30 it's packed so plan ahead. Decor = The place is fun and bright and a great way to start off your day.  Food = It was hard to pick from the menu since everything looked so scumpcious. I decided on Egg-straorindary breakfast with Eggs, potatoes, and Grits.   Grits = wow wow wow. Too good to be true. Never seem them like this, they are thick, but creamy, full of flavor. I would take any yankee who's hates on grits here to change their mind.  Eggs & potatoes = need more flavor.  Bisquit = An unexpected raspberry taste, quite interesting!  I'd come back and try another entree that included grits...yummm.

This place was packed on a Sunday morning before the Panthers game, but we were seated and got coffee right away! Our waiter was friendly and our food was quick and tasty! I always feel like a good sign at a restaurant is when you see regulars, and there were a ton here! I got a basic breakfast with eggs and their chicken sausage and I'd definitely have it again. I also got a big biscuit with my meal that was amazing.  They even offer you a to go drink which was a nice perk

Can you say siriously delicious. I am new to the Charlotte area and I simply Googled best breakfasts is in Charlotte. This restaurant pop up and my experience there was unmatched to any other I encountered in Charlotte thus far. I had the Flying Biscuit Meal which included grits comma chicken sausage, and something from Heaven called oatmeal pancakes. At first glance it sounded questionable. I could not believe how good this was it was fantastic. The oatmeal pancakes tasted as if it had fruit or something in it it was more of a dessert then breakfast but actually made of oatmeal so you don't feel so guilty. The Great's were the best I had in Charlotte so far that includes every restaurant Uptown and in Midtown the warm Peaches on top of the pancakes made me want to cry. And the biscuits were just sick. Topped with an apple butter you could not believe it was this good. Of course bring an appetite and prepare to have a take-home box because the portions are huge. I could not possibly eat it all in one sitting but, I enjoyed eating it all the next day. This will be a go-to place for me as long as I reside in Charlotte. Best breakfast ever. The Grits are out of this world they won't tell me what's in it though.

This is a great little place in a great shopping center. We were seated on the back porch it was a little cold outside but the heaters on the porch kept things nice and toasty. My group had a variety of breakfast entrees from a vegetarian omelette to my eggs and sausage everything was delicious. Do NOT miss the biscuits there's a reason the place is named after them. The service is exceptional and they are very kid friendly. My niece and nephew love eating there. When you're done feeding your body walk down to the Park Road Bookstore and feed your mind (review coming).

This was the best meal I've ever had on the road. I came in, was seated and had my food all within 15 minutes. Coffee was good and the staff was friendly and very well trained.   The grits. Oh my god the grits! No words just amazing.   The biscuits and gravy were perfect. I'm stuffed but cannot stop eating.   I'll be back next time (and every-time) I'm within an hours drive of this place.

Really cool little place. We've lived around the corner for 11 months now and just ate there for the first time this past weekend. Previous attempts falied due to the long wait, but this weekend we were up early enough to beat the crowd. The grits are the best I've ever had. Eggs and chicken sausage were also great, service was really friendly and the atmosphere is inviting. The only negative I will say is the starches are not their strength. I would stay away from items like french toast and the oatmeal pancakes. Those are really heavy and not what you expect. But I very much recommend the place stressing the grits, eggs and breakfast meats as their strengths.
Awesome breakfast! The Egg-Celtional eggs were so good, grits and biscuit were truly dreamy. Best breakfast in town.

I love going here for breakfast. I hate morning but sometimes my boyfriend will take me here to eat and it always is a great way to start my day. Quick service and delicious food. There is nothing you can go wrong with by ordering! Great place!

We walked by this place and decided to pop in for some lunch. This place has a LOT of vegetarian options! I was kind of overwhelmed with all the options, so I just chose this: Vegan BBQ Burrito: BBQ tofu, collard greens, and mushrooms folded in a sun-dried tomato tortilla topped with salsa verde (for those not so vegan, sour cream available upon request). This was good, but dang, it was really spicy. I could barely eat it, it was so spicy. I got my 2 year old some fried mac-n-cheese, but she was in a bad mood and wouldn't eat it. I tried it, and it was good! I have to say, though, for a place that has "biscuit" in their name, the biscuit I tried was not that good. I would give this place another try, though.

Customer service at its best. The line was long but well worth the wait. When I got inside the bartender served me an awesome Bloody Mary and a wonderful buscuitsbenadict. To say the least I will be coming back it was quite the venture and I will gladly add this to my 2nd visit list with the family.   A+

I really enjoy this place for brunch!  I got the steak and eggs with potatoes and I truly felt that I got the portion worth my money.  I appreciate how fast the food came and it tasted all so good.  The potatoes are to die for. I love potatoes and Flying Biscuits potatoes have the perfect seasoning and everything.  Definitely would go back for brunch next time!

Some friends from out of town were visiting for the weekend and one of their special requests was a good breakfast place, so we brought them here.  At first glance over the menu I was a little nervous there wouldn't be enough variety for our group but I was relieved when everyone found something that appealed to them.  I ordered the sausage gravy and eggs and it was amazing!  The sausage gravy was just right, not too runny but not too thick, and packed with flavor.  It was served over an egg (cooked however you like) on top of a split biscuit.  Yum!  The meal comes with a side of grits but I got potatoes instead which weren't all that great.  The hubby ordered the cajun chicken omelet which was also quite tasty.  The service was a little on the slow side but it was extremely busy when we were there.  This might be my new favorite breakfast place in Charlotte.

Honestly who knew the Flying Biscuit had booze?  Awesome, what a bonus! The grits at Flying Biscuit are fantastic, they are creamy, dreamy delciousness, perfectly salted and loaded with fat. What more could a girl ask for? A great little neighborhood spot with an outdoor patio too!
Some of the best breakfast food in Charlotte.  Absolutely love the Grits....  A must order even if you think you don't like grits.   You will once you have had these!

Not my favorite in the world but I would go back and try something different. I was up for the challenge of going out of my element and ordered the Shrimp n grits. Not my fave but they didn't disappoint. Think I want to try the fried green tomatoes next time.

Great for brunch. I had the chicken sandwich and it was quite good. Biscuits are awesome. Others were raving about the Mexican wrap. After repeated visits, the Chicken Club wrap is really tasty.  Good for takeout, too.
Get the grits. You will have your socks blown off. Everything is good really loved the seasonal lemon poppy seed pancake but all is good

Just left this restaurant  for the 1st time,on a rainy busy Saturday morning and I was impressed at the customer service and the quality of the food. My waiter was  really friendly and attentive. I ordered the piedmont omelet it was great. I love that this restaurant serves turkey bacon and chicken patties because I don't eat pork neither beef.  The restrooms were clean as well. I will return again whenever I'm in Charlotte!

Cozy little cafe in Park Road Shopping Plaza. Our waitress was awesome with our 16 month old... Even though he threw most of his food on the floor. The turkey meatloaf is loaded with flavor and the green beans were tasty. Ironically, the only thing that i found to be sub-par was the namesake... The biscuits. They were bland and didn't seem to be fresh made. Planning on going back again, especially on Wednesday nights for kid's night!

I was sort of disappointed in this restaurant. Our food was ok but their biscuits were not as good as I remember they were at the original location in Atlanta. The oatmeal pancakes were not as delicious as the picture made them out to be but the sausage pasta was delicious. For that alone I shall give this place another try!

no guys..... you don't have creamy dreamy grits! The benchmark is at Midnight Diner.  The omlet is weak, wt#! Compare yourself to The Original Pancake House......Biscuit is ok, I guess if you are carb monster.  With the mass invasion of Charlotte , all u have is location. Good luck with that.

Wow. This place must've been great at some point to get these reviews. However, it is not doing well now. The food was over cooked, they were out of biscuits (Ummm they're called flying biscuit) and gave my boyfriend old biscuits with his gravy. We will not be returning.

What's better than having breakfast served all day?? Maybe their apple cranberry butter smothered all over your fresh Flying Biscuit biscuit. Maybe. But that's a tough one.  Not only is this place great for their food, but the service is fast and friendly, and the prices are very affordable. I always have to make a stop here least once when I'm in town.

I'd been here once before with my dad when the place first opened. It was good then and just as good today. My wife and I stopped in at noon on a Tuesday and sat outside to enjoy the cool spring air. We were helped right away by our cheerful waitress and got started with beverages, etc.   I settled on the breakfast bowl but subbed the turkey bacon for the housemade chicken sausage. My wife ordered the high flyer breakfast. About 5 minutes later we were staring at some attractive looking breakfast dishes.   The bowl was a real knockout, the grits have been raved about and they are quite good. I enjoy grits made with milk and cheese that still retain the great corn flavor, Flying Biscuit does a nice job with these. The sausage comes buried under the fried green tomatoes and eggs so don't worry, it's in there. Speaking of which was very nice as well, good flavor, not greasy, maybe a bit salty for some. The tomatoes were actually my favorite part of the dish, cooked perfectly and the tartness helping to bite through the grits and sausage. Two over mediums on top were perfect as well. The red sauce was the only part of the dish I didn't jump up and down about, had a bit of a canned tomato sauce kind of thing going on. It was sparingly applied so no biggie. The biscuit was perfect for sopping up the grit, grease and yolk concoction at the bottom of the bowl!   My wife scarfed her entire meal down without much more than the occasional "mmmm" or "good grits" so I'll leave the review of that dish right there.   Quality food, good service, maybe slightly, slightly overpriced. We will be back to try lunch!

This started out really good.  Me and my husband are visiting the Charlotte area for the weekend, our neice wanted to take us to one of her favorite resturants.  We had a really short wait, and our food came out fast, and was really good.  The biscuits were amazing.  The server was really nice and friendly.  Here is were the problem started.....my husband had watery grits, and sent them back, the 2nd bowl came out even more watery.  When the check came he asked them to remove the grits.  Well a few minutes later here comes the MOST RUDEST MANAGER EVER!!!!She proceeds to ask my husband "What happened to the grits." My husband explained in a very nice way, that the grits were watery.  Erin the manager, starts to tell us there is no way those grits came out of there kitchen like that, and proceeds to tell us that he poured water into the grits.  My niece and husband explained again, that they came out this way, and furthermore what satisfaction would we get out of pouring water in grits.  She goes in on my husband, and he went back in on her, and things got WAY out of line, all over GRITS, AND her poor way of handling this.  I have worked in Customer Service, and the resturant business, for over 20 years, if she was a Manager at my store, she would be FIRED ASAP.  Lucky you don't work for me.  To the manager of this resturant Erin...if that's your real name...always Remember the 1st rule of customer service..."The Customer is always Right." Sorry for the low rating, wanted to give a 5, but your "Manager" ruined that.

Wow! Did you read the name of this place? I mean, seriously? Why would you not come here? Yelp led me to this awesome place and it did not disappoint. The grits literally were "creamy and dreamy". Aaaaaaaand we won't even get started on them biscuits...... that I HAD to get a second order of once Guillermo told me about the cran-apple butter that I totally forgot to put on my first biscuit. So now you see why I HAD to order another one. I mean, it was my civic duty! Soooooooo, when in Charlotte, you must, must, MUST try The Flying Biscuit Cafe! It's your duty to save the biscuits!

Ordered Southern Scramble... delicious!! Who'd a thunk collards, eggs and cheese go together? Grits were wonderful. Consider myself a connoisseur of grits. These are the "slow cooked w milk" variety. Yummm! My wife got the Egg-Stravaganza. French toast was out of this world good. Cooked perfectly w exactly the right amount of rasperry compote. Only knock on the whole experience was the service. Took forever to get our order taken, my ice tea was never refilled and the butter for my biscuit never showed up. Overall, still a "do over"!
Great for a chain restaurant. The grits are creamy The biscuits are huge  Try the Southern Scramble and The Turkey hash and you won't be disappointed.

A Breakfast Perfect Storm...  Though there appeared to be a long wait, in actuality the wait was not bad at all, as my 2 peeps and I were able to get seated within 5min.  We sat outside at a table, the fans were def crucial due to the heat.  There also was a faint rotting garbage smell coming from somewhere nearby as well.    FOOD: Everything was EXCELLENT! Grits:  Yea, I know what you're thinking.  I've had grits before.  They're not that good.  How good can a bowl of grits be?  I had those same exact questions going through my mind as I was trying to place my order.  I'm gonna come right out and say it, do yourself a favor and get the grits -  these are the best grits I've ever had.  PERIOD.    Meggxican Wrap:  It contained, "A spicy scramble of eggs, cheddar cheese, onions & Serrano peppers wrapped in a flour tortilla, topped with a warm tomato salsa and a dollup of sour cream served with creamy dreamy grits." (http://www.flyingbiscuit.com/Menus.aspx)  I added bacon to it, which I highly recommend.  The  Meggxican Wrap come together perfectly.  All of the ingredients perfectly complemented each other - the cheese complemented the eggs.  The bacon complemented the onions and peppers, and the warm tomato salsa spread across the top complemented the entire the dish. (see pics)  Biscuit:  Being from NY, I must admit, I am not a big Biscuit guy at all.  I prefer bagels and crouissants .  To me, biscuits are too doughy, dry out your mouth and are hard to swallow (that's what she said, lol).  But the biscuit was phenomenal!  It was baked perfectly, doughy but lite enough to swallow.  I can't comment on the apple butter - didn't try it; didn't need to.  The Biscuit was perfect with a little butter and jam.    My overall food experience here was AMAZING!  Everything was prefect.  I cannot shower the food with enough praises!  Everything tasted freshly cooked and prepared.  Everyone I was with also enjoyed their respective meals.  My friend got the Southern Scramble, which I sampled and can also offer my stamp of approval for.    Service:  Service was excellent.  Waitress was very polite & friendly but not intrusive.   She refilled our waters two or three times (hey, it was hot outside remember).  Food was not exactly lightening fast in arriving, but sometimes you don't mind waiting if you know the food is being freshly prepared.      Price:  VERY AFFORDABLE for the amount of food that you get.  You can also add extras and sides for minimal costs.   This place is definitely here to stay... ..and I'll def be Flying with the Biscuit again soon!

Oh my yum. We checked out The Flying Biscuit during our latest trip to Charlotte. This place gets slammed- our group of 5 had to wait about 30 minutes for a table, but it was well worth the wait! The food was ahhhmazing. The menu is extensive and serves everything from healthy to hardy. I had biscuits and gravy, and I also tried the eggs Benedict. Both were absolutely delicious! The biscuits are huge, and all of the sides were really tasty. It was nap time after eating there! We will definitely be back!

I've eaten here several times and I've never had a bad meal. Service is always quick, polite, and prompt. My go-to favorites are the salmon scramble and the Piedmont omelet. The Flying Biscuit uses chicken sausage & Turkey bacon in dishes. I don't feel that the lack of pork takes away from the taste. In fact, other flavors shine through without it. I always recommend this restaurant to people who have never been there.

This morning I decided to stop by the Flying Biscuit in the Park Rd shopping plaza for some brunch.  When entering, I immediately loved the decor...bright colors, some nice displays, old style pottery with sugar cubes at each table.  The waitress was extremely friendly and was extremely efficient.   The menu options were diverse and simple at the same time.  I ordered a grilled chicken wrap with 'moon dusted' potatoes.  Both items were delicious-- the rosemary and spices on the potatoes gave them a very unique and wonderful flavor.  Overall I was very pleased with the amount of food for the price, the atmosphere, and the taste of my brunch.  I would definitely go back to sample some of the other dishes!

What a find, forgot about it being Mother's Day when we headed out to breakfast. Huge line but wait was much less than expected.  However the service was excellent only exceeded by the food. My cardiologist wouldn't approve but the best biscuits and gravy I've ever had and the grits were a 10 also.  Wish you were closer to California.

Lived in Atlanta for many years (home of Flying Biscuit) so we are very familiar with the restaurant. This location is exceptional. Service was extremely good. Food was prepared as requested and that was with a couple of requests (well done, add this etc). Best grits ever. Anyone who says the don't like grits needs to try these grits...if you don't like these grits then - fine you don't like grits. Chicken sausage is better than pork sausage. The biscuits are beautiful and so delish. I suggest adding serranos to your eggs!  I don't give 5 stars easily!

I love this place since I'm not a fan of bacon but love breakfast.  Most places have no non-pork breakfast meats or probably cook them right after the bacon and sausage on the same equipment, but here pork is an afterthought that has to be specially requested.  My favorites are the Southern Scramble, the Turkeyloaf, Shrimp and Grits, and of course the biscuit itself (smothered in the apple butter)  Service has been a bit off the past couple times I've been and I pretty much had to blurt out my food order.  If it takes you several minutes to get my drink order I assume I won't see you for several more minutes for my food order.

The food is great, let me repeat... food is great. You just have to be prepared for the wait. If you go there on a Sunday morning, after a night of fun, don't expect to sit quickly or have service right away. However, the biscuits make up for the time spent in the parking lot of the Park Road Shopping Center -I could never work there because I would eat my weight in biscuits daily.

Best breakfast place in Charlotte hands down. Some favorites include- Flying biscuit breakfast- eggs any way, meat, creamy dreamy grits Turkey hash and gravy Eggs-strordinary breakfast with creamy dreamy grits.  Whatever you order get the creamy dreamy grits!!!!

What a disappointing visit I had this morning. I had high hopes for this place as it was recommended to me by a co-worker. We arrived around 9:45 am, had about a 30 min wait for a table (which is to be expected for a Sunday morning). After being seated our waitress quickly took our drink orders but after that we didn't receive our drinks for another 15 mins. After waiting an hour for a food it was served to us cold and I was given the wrong order. Normally I would not make a fuss about a wrong order but the food given to me contained items I was allergic too. Now having to get my meal replaced I had to wait another 30 mins for my meal. By this time it's 12:00pm and I am starving. Overall I did not have a good experience at this establishment and probably will not be returning. The only reason I am giving them 3 stars instead of 2 is because our waitress was extremely helpful, informative, and tried her hardest to make sure the meal was right the second time.
This is my favorite breakfast place.  The French toast is my favorite.  I am now gluten free and still go for breakfast.  Great menu.

This place has the best grits! My boyfriend gets the sausage gravy whenever we go and I like to mix it up. He is obsessed and he's from Mississippi, he knows his grits and sausage and gravy ha. Everything has been awesome and the waiters are so nice! I don't think I have ever ordered lunch here but I think I'm going to do that next time!

One of my favorite places. Their Shrimp & Grits are to die for. Definitely my last meal if I had to choose one. Their biscuits are fluffy and have sugar on top which adds a slight sweetness that is great. Breakfast is amazing here too.

Why are the biscuits here so hard? I have never met a biscuit I didn't like until eating at this flying biscuits. Other flying biscuits I have been too didn't have this problem, but this location puts something on their biscuits that makes the outside really hard. I always just pick out the middle like a squirrel. The other food options are ok but I just can't get past the fact that at a place called flying biscuit most tables I see them bus the customers have not eaten their biscuits. The grits are very good though.

During a weekend with the girls in charlotte, we found ourselves starving and craving breakfast at 2PM. Thanks to Yelp we found The Flying Biscuit Café and we agreed we had to go! We arrived to a packed house but the patio was open and there was a table wide open. We sat down quickly and we all had one thing on our mind... biscuits!  I wasn't long before our fabulous waitress Marissa eagerly greeted us. She put in our waters and coffee all around. Good friends, good weather, good waitress, we were definitely winning the day at this point.   I ordered the The High Flyer Breakfast. This was a huge meal and came with two eggs, chicken sausage (I got vegetarian!!), grits, and an oatmeal pancake with peaches... oh and a biscuit! I'm not kidding, this was so much freakin' food. While I tried, I did not succeed at cleaning my plate. I started with the biscuit and I must say, it was great. Fluffy, soft on the inside a little crust on the outside, everything you think of when you imagine a great biscuit. I added a little butter and this house made jam that was on the table. I always expect a lot out of a menu item that's I the name of the business and in this case, I approve! My eggs were also cooked perfectly, the vegetarian sausages were great, and I was surprised by the grits. I'm not a huge grits person but they were pretty damn tasty. I dove into the pancake last and I gotta say that I was not a fan. It was very tough and instead of enjoying it, I was caught red handed nibbling on my friend's original pancake. Now, that was a good pancake!   Overall, my party had a great time here and I would recommend it to anyone visiting or living near by. If you're lucky you'll snag Marissa as your waitress.!

Enough cannot be said about this place. The crowd says it all. Well worth a little wait. The grits are by far the best I have ever eaten. The staff, the service , the atmosphere, and food are all 5 star and perfectly priced. Next time we are in town we will be back.

I needed a good breakfast place to take my folks when they were in town - one that's not too pricey, so I settled on Flying Biscuit early on a Sunday hoping we'd miss the line.  We showed up at 9am and were easily able to get a table for 6.  I ordered the French Toast however, and it was ... different.  When I imagine French Toast, I think big, fluffy, flavorful bread with some hints of cinnamon, maybe some nutmeg.  The French Toast that I got was soggy wheat bread with some delicious raspberry glaze over it - which was the saving grace.  Without the raspberry sauce,  I would have been a very unhappy camper.    When we left around 10am, there was a long line and they won't sit you unless your entire party is there.  I'm not sure that I'll be back anytime soon - too many other breakfast/brunch places to try.

Southern style breakfast all day? What more could you want? I had the pleasure of having breakfast for dinner here. The atmosphere feels cozy and a homey feel to it.  Now the menu. Filled with lots of yummy options! I love a menu with lots of choices! Pimento cheese and fried green tomatoes were our appetizers and they did not upset. Somehow I went my whole life with trying fried green tomatoes and now I'm craving Flying Biscuit's tomatoes!  For my main dish I ordered the Cajun chicken scramble. Mmmm it was so good with the right amount of spice! Ofcourse i had their famous grits and it did not disappoint, creamy and made perfectly.  Can't wait to come back to try some dinner items!

The oatmeal pancakes with the peach capote are wonderful. My grandmother use to make oatmeal pancakes with peach capote (and strawberry capote & plum capote). That dear lady died 25 years ago, but eating the oatmeal pancakes here took me back to my childhood in east Texas.  The grits are fantastic and the biscuits may be the best I've ever tasted. I live in Dallas but occasionally travel to CLT for business, and every trip has at least one meal here.

Simply put: THE FOOD WAS AMAZING! The Black Bean Cakes were surprisingly delicious and HEALTHY (I assume) I immensely enjoyed the southern atmosphere! Great Food and People  Great Sunday Brunch destination

We went to the Biscuit Cafe at 8 pm on a Saturday night. They were welcoming and more than happy to serve a family of six. We had two adults and four kids. It was completely empty but super yummy so don't let that fool you!   We had the Lemon Poppyseed pancakes (special), a full size French toast, the Breakfast bowl, a Chorizo wrap, and chocolate chip pancakes.   All the pancakes were really good. Crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Flavor was so good.   The French toast was a bit small. Only two pieces of toast cut in half for the full size. And not as good as the pancakes.  Definitely not enough for a full size teen or adult.   The breakfast bowl was so good. The grits were the best I have ever had. (I'm from Arizona, but I am a big fan of grits.)   And don't get me started on the biscuits. The best biscuits ever. Huge and fluffy and great with the apple butter.

I'm mad...mad at myself for not coming here sooner. Living about 5 minutes away, I come to Park Road shopping center a lot. This is arguably overall, the best restaurant in the entire complex. The breakfast is awesome and the biscuits while not truly a traditional, southern style biscuit, are f'ing great. Every single traditional breakfast item is so so so so good. Turkey bacon...yep, chicken sausage...don't sleep on it, grits...some of the best I've ever had, which means a lot coming from an SC native. 5/5 because service was awesome, mimosas were great, and of course the meal was outstanding.

I rarely give chain restaurants 5 stars (FB was founded in ATL in 1993); however, this location continually  serves a hearty breakfast with warm smiles, hot coffee, and excellent service.  Kudos to Markisha for her joy of life, and to Bob (the hostess outside with the mustache) for his happiness even when slammed.  I know others might ding them on certain entrees, which I cannot comment since I eat only breakfast here, but the variety of their morning menu has never let me down.  Should I get the Southern Scramble, or the Smoked Salmon scramble, or The Piedmont omelet?  Hmmmm.  They're all so good.

What a great find!!!!  Everything was delicious.  Best grits I've ever had, turkey gravy amazing!!!!  Pot roast and eggs fantastic.  Yes we tried a little of everything!!! We will definitely be regulars!!!!

Went back on 10/26/12....still a great place for breakfast.    However, I was a little surprised that at 10AM there was a small group drinking beer and at times being a little loud and using profanity.  They appeared to be from a local hospital or medical center that just worked mids.  I expect this type of crowd at your local bar, not a breakfast place.   Next time I'm in the area I'll go back for some more great tasting biscuits, and hope the medical crowd has moved along.

I have had breakfast at a Flying Biscuit before, but this was my first time for dinner. I had UberEATS deliver a chicken pot pie and salad. OMG! The chicken was tender and plentiful! The gravy was a tad spicy and delicious! The veggies were crisp, and the biscuit topping the pot pie was flaky, crusty, and tender on the inside! Best cold-weather food EVER!
This place has a really great hot chocolate. Sweet and creamy with a smooth finish. Really a great place to meet a new friend or catch up with someone. I didn't try any of the food.

Meh.   I had to waive down someone to take my drink order. She informed me that she would go get my actual server, and when someone came over it was a different girl that informed us that she was not our server but she would take my drink order anyway.  She brought our drinks and took our order.  Someone else brought the food too.  Our "server" didn't show up until it was time for the check. -_-  We came because a friend recommended it, said the grits were amazing. They were good, but not as good as the Leroy Fox! The biscuit was good, I would've like to have been offered something to slather on it, like a jelly or jam. I just ended up putting my eggs on it.
Awesome apple butter & biscuits!!!! Service is a tad unorganized compared to pancake house. But again, the Apple butter and biscuits are phenom!!

I went for lunch and had a pleasant experience.  Although this is a small, regional chain the eclectic interior makes you feel like you are in an independent cafe.  Odd location deep inline in the shopping center with a very small sign so keep your eyes open.  I ordered the 3b grilled chicken sandwich with roasted potatoes and was very happy.  The aioli and blue cheese mixed well, although I think there could have been a little more blue cheese.  The turkey bacon had a nice flavor (for turkey bacon) and added some crunch to the sandwich.  The chicken was done well and still moist.  The bun, lettuce, and tomato were good compliments.  Service and atmosphere were average.  If you are close by, Flying Biscuit is worth a chance.

This place is always packed on the weekends. I've heard the buzz, passed up a few opportunities to try it until last weekend.   In the mood to stand in line, we waited only 15 minutes - not too bad with the amount of people gathered out front. Got a table on the back porch and loved the breeze.   Whether it was the amount of people in the restaurant or poor service, our waitress was running all over the place and not paying much attention to us.   Food was decent at best. Grits were creamy as advertised and were the bright spot of an otherwise forgettable meal.   Don't understand the hype, Still on the lookout for a great breakfast place in CLT.

Absolutely delicious!! The service was great too! There was nothing that anyone at my table didn't enjoy. The mocha is beautiful, sweet & addictive. My meggixican burrito served with creamy dreamy grits and a biscuit was DELICIOUS!  The biscuits are huge and the grits are out of this world! Wish I could make my own grits just like that! This is definitely a place to enjoy, but be ready to wait... For an amazing breakfast experience!

I was not impressed by the food; however, I was very impressed with the fun decor. They have done a great job with the ceiling tiles! Lots of color, lots of fun scenes of utensils or animals and clouds...fun table settings and accessories. The atmosphere is very colorful and will possibly overload your senses.   The food was less than good and frankly, disappointed us. I had heard good things about this place and was eager to see how vegetarian-friendly it was. They do offer veggie friendly entrees, but it is by no means a vegetarian establishment. They LOVE their sausages and bacon! I wanted to try something Southern, so I tried the grits and biscuits (thinking they are their signature items). Coming from the West, grits are very foreign to me. Their grits were thick and tasted like they were made with sour cream. I was not a fan. When I think biscuits, I think "plain, nothing fancy." Their biscuits have crystallized sugar on top. I know I highlighted two items, but we ordered more. I'm not going to review everything, since it was so disappointing and didn't make us feel good (not that we felt bad, but when I eat, I like to feel good about it).   Since it was the opening weekend, I expected high energy and enthusiasm. The server was great, but the manager or whoever that stopped by to check on us wasn't what I had expected for a grand opening. Not friendly, but not not friendly...just checking on us.   So, sad to say, this is not a stop we'll be making again.

This is a great place and one of my favorites. Food is wonderful. But, after last Thursday breakfast with my husband I don't know what to think. The music was inappropriate with all the sexual content and comment. I have never been so offended by something and its probably okay in a club. Not a eatery.
Not as outstanding as reviews led me to believe but so much better for breakfast than something like iHop or Denny's.

This is a brunch stand by. The interior & offerings are similar to a joint in SoMa or in the Castro district in San Francisco - hippie chic.    I love the white cheddar grits.  The other fare provides twists on standards like chocolate chip or buckwheat pancakes.  There are the standards like the 2 or 3 egg plate w/potatoes & fruit or grits. How can you go wrong w/brunch all day!  Need gluten free or vegetarian w/ease - the Flying Biscuit is the place.
SERVICE excellent FOOD Excellent  Will be coming back Kelly was the server and I really enjoyed  her..

I very much enjoyed my meal here, the food was quite good, and the friendly, funny staff made it even better.  Located at Park Road Shopping Center (if you look towards the middle of the strip, it will be slightly to the right of center, in close proximity to Suarez Bakery), what a fun, cute place for a meal.  Park Road SC is currently redoing their signage, so it's a little more difficult to spot a new-to-me place, but the banner signs are readable.   There is parallel parking just in front of the stores, or there is plenty of angled parking in the lot.  The place:  Cute space with both booths and tables/chairs, along with a small bar.  Brightly colored Hawaiianish table cloths make for a happy environment.  The staff:  Ridiculously friendly and knowledgeable of the menu.  When I asked the waitress for what her favorites were, as I had never been to a Flying Biscuit before, she gave me some suggestions with explanations.  Awesome!  The food:  I took the waitress's suggestion and ordered the High Flyer, which offers a sampling of everything - 2 eggs, grits, chicken sausage and a pancake.  I substituted a blueberry pancake for the oatmeal pancake, which I ate with only the light dusting of powdered sugar that it was served with, and it was delicious - light and full of blueberry flavor.  The eggs were cooked to my over-well request and were very good, not greasy at all, with the perfect crispness that I like.  The grits were indeed creamy and dreamy and probably the best grits I have ever eaten.  The chicken sausage was well flavored and cooked to perfection (I wasn't a huge fan of it, but I think that is my personal taste and not a reflection of the sausage).  And the biscuit... well... again, I wasn't a fan.  For the type of biscuit that it was, it was well flavored and structured, with a little sugar baked on top for a sweet, slightly crunchy finish, but I like lighter, biscuitier biscuits (Cracker Barrel, Poogan's Porch in Charleston), but they were good.  The accompaniment of the cranberry apple butter in a squeeze bottle was amazing - that was delicious and I could have eaten that right from the bottle - YUM!!  We also tried the grilled mac and cheese which are molded rectangles of mac and cheese.  $3 for 3 rectangles - it was mac and cheesy (good to cure a macheese craving, nothing spectacular).  Wednesday, as the cute young man told me when I entered, is kid's night.  I don't know what kid's night entails, but there will be squealing children and wincing mommies getting glass after glass of wine.  The food was a solid 4 and with the addition of the awesome staff, I am rounding up to a 5.
Great service! I love coming here for breakfast and eating outside on the patio with my dog.

This is a great spot to meet a friend for breakfast or brunch and I mean A (one) friend. The restaurant works hard to pack larger parties into the tight space but that's really not their target market. Cafes are typically quaint, smaller tables, intimate atmospheres... The Flying Biscuit, somewhat, desired that feel but didn't quite hit it. Their biscuits became to popular.  Now, by biscuits, I don't mean the kind you want to grab with grease covered chicken fingers. These biscuits are sweeter, a little more dense and have a dusting of sugar on top. Almost more sourdough in texture but not exactly. Delicious, paired with the right breakfast accompaniments but don't expect Bojangles.  The service is fairly quick considering the small space, large groups, issue. I think my friend were in and out within 30 minutes, maybe less. Honestly, we would have sat around a while but we didn't want to hold up a table.  If I could pick a home town for this cafe, it would be Asheville. If you haven't been to Asheville, it's a smallish city with some hippie vibe but surrounded by money. Kind of an odd collection of people but totally unique. That is somewhat how I feel about the menu at Flying Biscuit, too. Some, not so traditional, breakfast items mixed with some more common ones. More expensive than an IHOP but the restaurant wanted a different, unique vibe. Peas in a pod, really.
There are so many good things on the menu here but I keep getting my standard (even for dinner): eggs, biscuit and gravy.

My fiancé and I visited this place for breakfast based on Yelp reviews.  Bad idea.  Our waiter offered drinks and took our orders shortly aftee.While waiting for our food I was on my phone and the clock said 12:08 pm.Our food came to our table at 12:12 pm.It took 4 minutes to make 1 order of bacon,eggs,grits and a biscuit plus 1 order of French toast,bacon,eggs,grits and a biscuit.Needless to say we were incredibly surprised (and suspicious) by how quick our food was ready.  Once we started eating we were left disappointed by how bland the food was.The bacon reminded me of bacon at a hospital cafeteria and the grits were ok at best.His French toast was two very,very thin and extremely soggy pieces of toast with raspberry sauce drizzled on top.The eggs were also tasteless.Oh,and our waiter never checked in with us once our food arrived at our table.My fiancé said theirs better breakfast at McDonald's.I know it's hard to believe that last statement but honestly,this place is nothing special.What a waste of time and money..  If you want a good plate of food,go elsewhere.I only give this place one star because the biscuit was pretty good.However,we won't be visiting again.

The hunt for the best brunch in Charlotte led me to the Flying Biscuit Cafe. I've heard of their legendary biscuits and needed to give this place a try. My experience was unfortunately not the best. This is probably due to getting take-out instead of actually eating at the cafe. I had the biscuit, eggs and gravy. By the time I got home, the biscuit was a bit on the hard side which is contrary to the warm, soft, flaky goodness I was expecting. I have to give this place 3 stars for now. The $10 didn't really seem to be a good value in my opinion. I'll give The Flying Biscuit another try in a couple of weeks however and see how it measures up for dine-in.

Good place for the health conscious.  The male host was a little rude to my mother when she walked into the establishment to wait. (It was hot outside). He abruptly told her they do not allow anyone to wait inside. Other than that the place has cool atmosphere and good food.

First visit to Flying Biscuit Cafe. Did not notice this eatery, so easy to walk by this place if it were not for the tables outside and a menu board. We walked in and a guy sat us in a booth which was near revolving doors-so we heard everything coming in and out of these doors.   It was not busy here at all. The waitress came by gave us menus and asked us what we wanted to drink. When she returned with drinks, she asked what we wanted to order. You would imagine she would give us a clue as to the specials or other items of interest on the menu. Nothing.   Asked here what kind of steak was the flat iron, and she was able to answer the question. So we placed our order. When the food came, we felt rushed. She came by to see if we wanted to package our food. I said okay for a container. She came back with a container. I was still eating the steak n eggs. The biscuit was hard and the grits was salty. Waitress then came back asked if this was going to be together or separate checks.  We did not leave until I finished the egg and a piece of the steak. Ignored the waitress as she walked by looking at the checks and spent time catching up with my friend.  There were patrons before us when we sat down and they were all still there. We were rushed. This place was not busy at all. Lots of empty tables and chairs.   Waitress never refilled our drinks. Bad customer service.  Will not be back.

The Flying Biscuit is by far one of my favorite and "go-to" places in Charlotte.  Whether you are interested in breakfast, lunch, dinner, girl's night, or date night - the Flying B is your place!  The food is different and delicious.  It's got that home-style feel with a funky twist.    Mind Blowers: * Anything with the word BLT in it. * Fried Green Tomatoes with Goat Cheese * Brie * The Veggie Scramble * The Sausage Gravy - get it.  Don't ask questions * orange-infused whole wheat French toast * Grits (I've heard people would give up their children for the Flying B's grits!) * ....and pretty much everything else  Other Important pieces of Information: * The staff rocks * Yes, they have a full espresso bar for you coffee addicts, nom nom nom * Yes, they serve alcohol * Yes, they have wireless * This place is a zoo on the weekends.  If you are planning on going for breakfast on Saturday or Sunday get there in time to wait for 10-20 minutes.  Don't be put off by the line outside, it moves fast! * The Flying B is family friendly - so if babies or children freak you out, better find somewhere else to eat (On that note, babies and children freak me out and I still go here as much as humanly possible).  Point being - if you live in Charlotte and you don't go to Flying Biscuit you probably aren't an American.

LOVE this place! Food is great especially the grits. Creamy and buttery. I've been here several times and each time there was always at least a 20 minute wait. Crowded entry way so you'll find yourself either crammed in there like sardines or outside hanging out. I highly recommend the sausage gravy with eggs over biscuits.

I do think Flying Biscuit is a bit expensive, but they serve mostly organic and gluten free products.  So in that sense, its a steal. I would rather pay more for simple ingredients.  Their portions are also huge! So you can get the High Flyer for 6 or 8 bucks- but split it with someone else.   Being from Wilmington, NC- Breakfast places are a staple.  It has been hard to find good eclectic breakfast places in Charlotte.  So if that is what you're looking for, come here!  I've been for both breakfast and dinner and out of all the times I have been here, not once have I been disappointed.

Definitely one of our favorite brunch spots in Charlotte! Food is always quick, coffee is great, and the staff is so nice! It's a great atmosphere inside, with good music and fun art on the walls and the ceilings. The menu is also on the healthier side while still getting a great tasting traditional breakfast. I always get the Eggstravaganza!   This is one of our favorite brunch places to bring out of town guests. Always a big hit! There is usually a little wait, but there's a Hallmark right down the way that is a fun place to pass the time. Always worth that wait!

I've been to the Flying Biscuit on several occasions, and have never had a bad meal. The service is always great, and the selection of food is outstanding! It will definitely be in my breakfast rotation. You will not be disappointed.

One word: WOW. I don't even know where to begin the description of the awesomeness, because it was ALL that good. The inside looks interesting, but still inviting with the colorful tabletops. I followed what some other yelpers suggested and got the Cajun Eggs - did not disappoint. Fried green tomatoes were an appetizer, and they were gooey without being too crispy. These were my first fried green tomatoes since I'm not a N. Carolina native, but still great. My boyfriend had the blueberry pancakes and we basically shared. You could actually taste the lightly sweetened pancake and the fresh blueberries. So good. So filling. If I lived around here, I would definitely come back. Multiple times.

Great food and fun atmosphere! Don't go for Sunday brunch unless you are willing to walk around the shopping center for a little while while you wait to be seated. The biscuits are HUGE and fluffy and the eggs are delicious!
Amazing food. I had the egg scrambled with salomon. My husband who never wants to try anything new loved it as well. We will return soon.
A nice little place for breakfast and brunch.   The chocolate biscuit pudding was really tasty.
Amazing! The grits are ridiculously delicious, as is the Apple butter on every table. Our server was really sunny and cheerful on a rainy day, and took great care of us. We will definitely be back!

Only checked out the Flying Biscuit recently but it is outstanding. A word of warning that if you plan for Saturday or Sunday breakfast, get there EARLY. They have plentiful seating move tables fast but the people pile in even faster.  Best breakfast dish on the menu is the flatiron steak and eggs. I know what most of you are thinking, breakfast steak you are probably going to get a flimsy select-grade sad excuse for a steak. Not here! I got a thick portion of steak (somewhere in the 6-8oz range) that was better than some steakhouses I've been to, definitely the best I've ever had for breakfast! It was served with eggs cooked however you like (even poached!), grits seasoned to perfection, and a funny looking biscuit so good I ordered a half dozen to go (ask for the apple butter if you get it to-go).  Our server Teala was a gem as well. Bold on personality, grand on service!  Thanks to everyone at the Flying Biscuit for making the Park Road Shopping Center a regular destination!

5 stars! My boyfriend and I brought my parents and dog here for Saturday brunch. We were seated immediately outside. Both the host and waitress were incredibly friendly. My parents and I really enjoyed the french toast, while my boyfriend enjoyed the southern style benedict. All was delicious!

They had great service and were prompt on taking my order and bring out the food. I particularly didn't find the food anydifferent from any other breakfast spot. The only dish that stuck out to me was the fried green tomatoes.  It was served with cream cheese and was new. I would go there again to give them a second chance to wow.

This place is great. Food is always good and the service is excellent. There is generally a little bit of a wait, but if you come in anticipating that you should be fine. Generally avg of 15 mins or so.
Park Road shopping center location is filthy and rude wait staff.

Enjoyed a nice breakfast this morning.  A 30 minute wait was passed in a nice chair on the sidewalk. Many comings and goings. Once inside, we were greeted by a handsome waiter, very efficient service, plenty of refills, very attentive service. Biscuit was huge. A little lackluster on the oatmeal pancake but the peach compote was yummy. Love the grits. I have enjoyed my visit. Between Peace and Hominy and Flying Biscuit in Charlotte and the Plucked Up Chicken in Columbus, Georgia,  I have eaten well in some Zany named food spots. Love a catchy name and the foods met their mark each place.

Y'all!!! This is sooo good! We were here on vacation and it was a four star on Yelp and said there was a wait on weekends...we stopped in on a Friday and small wait but not bad probably 10 minutes. I had the biscuits egg and gravy with grits my husband had an omelette with a side of gravy it was excellent! I have had tons of grits being from the south and these were creamy and GREAT I was skeptical about chicken gravy but it was some of the best white gravy as good as momma used to make!! You won't be disappointed I promise if I could give 6 stars I would

Everything about this place is good, the atmosphere, the lively weekend crowds, and the food is great. However, they are not Second Amendment supporters. They have a NO HANDGUN sign on the front door. Criminals, by their very nature of breaking the law, will not let a sticker on a door stop them from perpetrating their acts. Law-abiding Second Amendment supporters have been shown time and time again to be responsible citizens. We take the responsibility of carrying a firearm very seriously, and we are not about to break the law to go to jail and to lose our precious God-given right to self-defense. Over and over again, these so-called gun free zones are simply shooting galleries for criminals. For this reason I cannot recommend this restaurant, even though they have gone out of their way to craft custom breakfast meals for me that are not on the menu.
Grits where fantastic eggs an sausage but a little over priced nice place very friendly service i will return to try the hotcakes

This is the Charlotte version of Asheville's Early Girl.  Vegetarian and GF choices clearly marked.  Modifications made without fuss.    Everything was delicious.  Grits needed no additions.  Coffee was excellent.  We ate on the back deck, overlooking a parking lot and gardening store.

I was REALLY excited to try flying biscuit after friends raving about it. I came here on Sunday morning around 10. There was a wait, but I didn't mind because I knew it was going to be worth the wait..... Ugh I was wrong.   I ordered the southern style eggs Benedict and I'm not kidding it took over an hour. As we waited for our food I think our server refilled our coffee once and we had to ask for silverware after our food came. That's such a pet peeve of mine. Anyways I think they forgot to cook my meal fully because I had shredded cheese on my eggs and it was still shredded. It was not cooked. I was starving so I just ate it. The food was cold and the biscuit, which I was most excited for, was over cooked and hard. Plus we had to track our server down to get or check.   I would love to give the flying biscuit another try, but my first time left a bad taste in my mouth...

This is one of my absolute favourite spots in Charlotte! I have certain dietary restrictions but can always find something here. They have a diverse selection of unique entree options and of course the biscuits are fantastic, dusted with the slightest bit of sugar, paired with their apple butter, will absolutely have you coming back.

When I walked in for yelpy hour the first thing that popped up in my head was how unique the decor was! The place looks like someone couldn't decide on a color scheme and just mash in as many colors that would fit into a space.     I only tried the shrimp and grits, and biscuits with apple cranberry butter. On the first spoon of grits I was in love, such creamy grits with a perfect amount of seasoning! As for the biscuit I was not much of a fan as it was very hard and unappetizing. I ended up using it to scoop up the delicious apple cranberry butter.     Hopefully next time I try this place the biscuits will be better, which they should be since they're in the name.

First time and we will be back  This has been one of those places that I wanted to visit for a number of years because of the name, my wife thought it served only biscuits. Finally got her to take a look at a very large and eclectic menu and she changed here mind.  Drove down from Cornelius this morning which was a rather cool April Sunday Morning.  Arrived around 11:45am and there was a line but we were told that the wait was only about 15 minutes which proved to be fairly correct.  Granted it was chilly and was still in the high 30's the wait was tolerable.  Looking around while we waited, we could tell that this place was dog friendly because of the number of water bowls around. I would assume that if you have a dog, you can sit at one of the sidewalk tables with your furry friend. A bit cool for that today.  Our name was called and we were promptly seated.  First order of business was two cups of coffee, as much to wrap our hands around as to sip. Coffee was of excellent quality and nice and robust and served to warm up both inside and out.  While we waited, my wife went ahead and ordered a Coffee White Russian and while I may be missing something, a Black Russian is made with Kahlua which is a Coffee Liqueur so what's the difference. In any case, she enjoyed it and that is all that matters.  For her entree, she ordered the Turkey Meatloaf with Mashed Potatoes, Green Beans and a Rolls. For my entree, I ordered the 3B ( Bacon, Basil and Bleu Cheese) on a grilled Chicken Breast , Bread, Romaine and Tomato.  Both proved to be excellent choices, The server gave me option of regular bacon as opposed to the turkey bacon which is standard on this sandwich which I did.  All in all, the food was outstanding and there are many more items on this rather creative menu I wish to explore at a later visit.  Service is very good and the decor is very light and reminiscent of Haight Asbury from the 60's.  Love the decor.  We will definitely be back. A bit cool today and they do have a rear patio with gas heaters but still a bit warmer on the inside.

We wait 30mins to be seated as they were super busy. But the man upfront with the super cool mustache was friendly so I didn't mind the wait with my girlfriends.  Finally we were seated and it took a while for our waitress Kelly to come over but when she did she took our order. Since it took so long to get our food she bought us free biscuits so we wouldn't starve to dead but I must say the biscuit reminded me of store bought bisquick mix with a brush of cinnamon and sugar.   At last the food arrives...i had the flat iron steak with cheese eggs and a strawberry crepe. My girls had omelets and again we both got the huge bisquick biscuits again.   The food was good and filling but the star of the show was the grits!!! I had never had grits so creamy in my life that alone would make me want to go back and they had a delicious blood Mary.

The Flying Biscuit is an interesting cafe. I came here with my wife to have breakfast and I left enlightened. Charlotte has a really special breakfast place worth going to if your in town. We dined in and I ordered a spinach omelet with a side of applewood smoked bacon, The spinach omelet was made with egg whites and came with a bowl of mixed fruit which was good. I'm not a vegan by any means but this meal had me leaving this fine establishment feeling like Popeye. The waiter was attentive to request and the food was delish! That earns 5 stars in my book. I will definitely be back.

Summary: Original menu, over-the-top friendly service, and hands-down the best grits I've ever had.   Atmosphere: After a 20-minute wait, our party of 34 (yes, 34) was seated on their back patio. The interior was fun, but the patio more than accommodated our large group, and was equally enjoyable (if not more so; who doesn't love the fresh air?). Our servers were sharp and yet relaxed. Didn't miss a beat, and everything was prompt.   Food:  Get the Sledgehammer for your drink (5 shots of espresso and steamed cream). I got the Smoked Salmon Scrambler for brunch. Great ratio of dill cream cheese to smoked salmon; good stuff. The biscuit was flavorful (topped with a pinch of salt).   But the coup de grace was the grits.   My momma's from the south, but I was raised in NY; this means finding grits in any restaurant is a disappointment. But going on the word of my sister (who lived in Charlotte for a few years), I got the grits. And I ate them. And everyone else's who didn't want their side. Seriously, the best grits I've ever had next to my own momma's.   Negative: They only had XL "OMG" tshirts. We wanted 2 smalls and 1 medium. Bummer. Looks like we'll just need to go back.

I went here for breakfast and loved every second of it- only wish there was a Flying Biscuit in Boston!  I got the High Flyer breakfast which was way too much food, but a great mix of everything.  The grits were probably the best I've ever had, and I didn't leave one bite behind- they were creamy & delicious. The oatmeal pancake with peach compote & the biscuit which had just a little bit of sugar on top, were equally good.  Knowing I wouldn't be able to eat all of that food, I left the eggs behind since I figured I could get those anywhere!  Cute space, open floor plan, friendly service, reasonable prices.  If I had to dock points for anything it would be that they're located in a strip mall which is a little less appealing, but for food this good who gives a flying biscuit?!

Mmmm flying biscuits. Ok, the biscuits didn't actually fly here, but they were really good. The wife and I came here looking for a simple breakfast to go.  Flying Biscuit did not disappoint. I ordered for takeout over the phone and opted for some pancakes, a bacon/egg/cheese biscuit, some of the creamy dreamy grits, and grilled mac and cheese sticks.  Because who can say no to grilled mac and cheese sticks.  The place was a bit packed when we arrived so did have to wait quite a while for our food to come up, but I liked the prices here.  Nothing was overpriced, the range was very easy on the pockets.  When the food came up we decided to eat it at the bar.  I will say it disappeared very quickly.  The pancakes were pretty decent; but not anything special.  Surprisingly, the same goes for the grilled mac.  It was cool to get mac and cheese that looked like French toast sticks, but they were only "pretty good."  If you get them, you want be disappointed, but you won't be pleasantly surprised either.  The biscuit on the breakfast sandwich was warm, buttery and good. But the star was the dreamy grits.  Everybody has grits, but it's hard to do them right - Flying Biscuit does them very right, lol.  I would recommend coming here if you're looking for your basic breakfast choices and want something decent; but I would recommend them even moreso if you had a craving for some good grits.
Friendly service, good food, using some healthy alternative ingredients.
First time eating breakfast in Charlotte, don't want to eat anywhere without Claudia serving me.  a+

Love this place! Service is always great and the food is amazing! Get the grits! I usually order the Piedmont Omelette as it comes. It this time I asked for egg whites instead and 10x better. Will order it like that from now on. And oh em gee the Lemon Poppyseed Pancakes are EVERYTHING!  Also it's usually a wait but well worth it.
This is my favorite of the two Charlotte locations.  The food is great, the sevice is great, and the atmosphere is nice.  I eat here about once a month and always enjoy it!

This place was a big disappointment. They have two vegan options but the one I tried (Tofu Scramble) was alright, I guess. My boyfriend was also not incredibly happy about his meal (garden scramble) and he said that the biscuit (the thing that they're named after) was pretty bland and his potatoes were cold. The service was also really bad. Our waitress took our order, while doing so I asked a simple vegan question (Are your moon dust potatoes vegan?) and she just said "I don't know." without offering to check. Well, that was the last time we saw her until it was time to give us the check. She passed our table like every three minutes and never thought to ask us how our meal was going.   I wouldn't mind not returning.

Everything was fantastic. I had French Toast with raspberry sauce , applewood smoked bacon and a biscuit with amazing apple butter .  They were busy , but they served quickly and efficiently and I was in and out in less than 20 min. I will be going back .

I love the feel of the restaurant. Nobody can take that look away from them. This is what a Southern diner should look like. It's done right and not over the top. That's what gives it that character you expect to see in a chain restaurant. Then again, I just said it was a chain. And like most chains, the food is a hit and a miss, depending on the day and the employee on duty. This is "family owned," but it's a chain, folks.  I've been here three times for lunch. The prices are decent for the food I'm getting, but nothing really urged me to come back. And that's something I won't be doing for a good while. Now, before I continue, I went here for lunch, but wanted to try their all day menu items. It should be safe, right? Hmm...no.   We went in and had great service from the start. There is NOTHING wrong with their service. Our server was probably one of the BEST I've seen in a long time. Ordered our food and got some biscuits while we waited. Love the biscuits though. Not too flaky or doughy. Just the right mixture for my tastes.   I ordered the Bacon and Egg combo with potatoes as my side. When it came out, I thought it was joke. It was literally two eggs fried, burnt bacon that had the consistency of an icicle, and a scoop of seasoned potatoes. Nothing special at all. What was worse? I paid nearly $8.50 for this! Are you kidding me. I would've gone to Waffle House and got twice as much and just the same quality if not BETTER. The other meals that I've gotten here aren't too bad, but still run along the lines of mediocre Southern dining to me. And it seems overpriced for the quality of food you expect to deserve.  I'm disappointed. If this is what "Southern dining" is, then you can keep it until you prove me otherwise.

I get board and go on what my friends and family call "Adventures". So I came across Flying Biscuit when I was suppose to be going to class one day. I so happy I deceided to be late that day. I had the Southern Scramble. It was freaking awesome. Collard greens, turkey bacon, cheese and a side of their Dreamy Grits. I was so stuff I didn't eat again until dinner. The food is so fresh and they use organic ingredients. There whole menu is full of great meals. Just writing this review make want to leave work and go there now. So go have breakfast or brunch or even dinner there you will not be disappointed.

The breakfast is amazing (with the exception of the coffee which is never good), but service is sub-par. During breakfast, waiting for a table is a free-for-all and they're super inconsistent. We were once skipped on their wait list for no reason. Another time the waiter forgot to put our order in. Other times we waited a super long time for the check. When they make mistakes, they don't offer anything beyond an apology.  Could be so much better if they got their queuing and table service in order.

Not impressed, probably won't go back and can't recommend it based on our visit. The service was fine--restaurant was empty except for one other table. I think they must get a lot of lunch traffic, but we were there on Friday for supper. Only half of my meal (a breakfast plate) was good--the grits were indeed creamy and delicious, but I suspect they had been microwaved, because there was a sticky film rimmed around the bowl. The pork bacon was crispy and not greasy. But my scrambled eggs were overcooked and rubbery, and the biscuit (the signature item) was the size, shape and consistency of a baseball. It was also cold. My companion had biscuit topped chicken pot pie, which was like chicken stew served on top of a biscuit, topped with a biscuit, and served with--you guessed it--a biscuit. The chicken filling had a good flavor with plenty of chicken and vegetables, but all the juice was absorbed into the dry biscuits. I would rather eat canned biscuits than the ones they serve. Very disappointing.

Had early breakfast here on Sunday and was actually disappointed.  This restaurant is a chain, and I had tried a branch before in Houston.  I had fond memories, but the Park Road location didn't live up to them.  My girlfriend ordered steak and eggs while I tried a half order of the French toast. Her steak was the best part of the meal.  Grits were OK, but nothing spectacular.  Biscuit was large and flavorful, but the French toast was lacking.  The cook tried to make up for the weak flavor by smothering it in raspberry sauce and condensed milk, but much was still lacking.  And prices were high for quality of food - disappointing overall!

Really wanted to rate this two stars, but the excellent service won me over.  So full disclosure I love brunch, but hate eggs.  So I was SOL at flying biscuit.  Just about everything included eggs.  Usually I can work around this, and I did - but the food was just mediocre.  Facts are I prefer Tupelo Honey a lot more.  Tupelo wins on hashbrowns, on bacon and on french toast...it's a tie for biscuits.  I'll give them this  Flying Biscuit does a really good biscuit.  It'd be criminal if the biscuit sucked.  Our waiter was charming and attentive.  He saved my dining experience.    This place is a far trek from Concord and there are far better options - hell waffle house is better IMO.

The Flying Biscuit was just pure amazing. I love that they offer non pork breakfast meats. The turkey bacon was great, the grits were some of the best I've ever had, and the oatmeal pancakes were like nothing I've had before. It seemed like a great crowd of people that frequent the place, the staff were top notch and we enjoyed the artwork. Sadly, I have to admit, the only thing I wasn't thrilled about was the biscuits, everything else though gets an A+ in my book.

My boyfriend and I went on a Sunday during brunch time. Worth the 15 minute wait. I had the oatmeal pancakes with peach compote. The compote was too sweet for my taste, but the pancakes were thick and amazing with the oatmeal in them. I had a side of moon dusted potatoes and they were delicious, not greasy or heavy on the stomach. I tried my boyfriends southern Benedict sandwich and it was very flavorful. The grits were delicious and creamy, almost like my grandmother used to make, southern style and such. They definitely didn't clump up and get nasty like most grits do. Also, the flying biscuits are amazing!!! They have some sort of sugar on top and it makes them irresistible. Definitely will come back for the awesome monthly specials and the drink menu!!!

My BF ordered the shrimp  and grits - devoured it! He enjoyed his meal and he doesn't like to venture much.   I ordered the egg Benedict with pimento cheese . The combination with the biscuit was really tasty!   We went early on a Monday morning, no wait time, quick service, friendly staff.  Total cost of $38 (including 2x coffee  )

The Flying Biscuit never lets us down! My fiance and I are almost happy we moved to this area just because of this restaurant alone. We tried swaying from our favorite Sunday brunch spot to try Harper's in South Park but realized what a mistake we made, so back to Flying Biscuit we went!   Although the line can be extremely long on weekends, the staff always gets everyone sat in a very timely manner. Then the service is always very quick too! Whether you want a quick brunch or one where you relax and enjoy, this is the place. We took family here when they came in town and it was their favorite experience of all the restaurants we visited that weekend.   You can't go wrong with biscuits and gravy, I've had several of their omelettes which are all wonderful and the biscuits are great too!   This place will definitely continue to be a regular spot.

The service was great and the food was amazing. I had the chicken pot pie. The biscuits and apple butter are to die for. They serve breakfast lunch and dinner all day. You can't go wrong with this place. I will certainly be back!
Good breakfast, service good had Eggs Benedict with pimento cheese(a little hot) but good, creamy grits. Portions are large.
Adorable little cafe with great breakfast. It's so much better than those big chain restaurants. Prices are good too. Will definitely be returning.

I could see this becoming a Sunday morning staple if I lived nearby. Service was efficient and everything was served hot and fresh. I personally prefer buttermilk biscuits but their soda biscuits are exceptional in their class. This isn't your cookie cutter "IHOP" breakfast. Their OJ is a bit over priced at $3.49 for a 12 oz glass. Otherwise the food is reasonably priced.
The sever was great along with the food. It was a friendly and welcoming atmosphere! Great choice for a brunch place here in Charlotte!
Excellent food!   Omlette was awesome except they used diced chicken and it was a bit overcooked but the CokaCola glazed salmon salad was absolutely amazing and enough for a full lunch.

Staff is super friendly and quick. Perfect place if you want to grab breakfast before work. Kitschy diner theme interior. Food was ok, not the best, but it fills you up. Portions on eggs are on the small side. Biscuits are dry, but are made up with apple butter. French toast on the dry side as well that cannot be fixed with syrup or butter bc of the type of bread being used. Grits are creamy and buttery.  Good place for a fast early am fix.

Biscuits Gravy Grits are a must IF... you are from the South. And this place is plating them up perfectly. I mean I don't even really like grits and I loved their shrimp and grits. I got a biscuit too with their homemade strawberry jam which was not bad either lol. Come here for your southern fix!

What can I say?  Moving to the South there are a few things I had to get used to.   #1 Sweet tea is EVERYWHERE... #2 Grits And the place to find the best creamy dreamy grits in Charlotte?  Flying Biscuit! I am in love with them and they have so many amazing items on their menu.  I went vegetarian about a year ago and they have things to accomodate me, and before that, their Turkey Hash was AMAZING!   I stick with the French toast because that glaze they use is so sweet and good, I love it.  I recommend this place to everyone.  They also have two seperate outdoor seating areas, booze, and different coffee drinks.

Great brunch spot! If you are craving for some creamy grits and the most perfectly baked buttery biscuit this is the place to come. The service is fast and on point. I tried the salmon as well and it was delicious. Good portion sizes as well. You will keep coming for those creamy heavenly grits :)
Really good food and selections.  The mimosas are the best! Depending on the day, the wait can sometimes be lengthy but the food is well worth the wait.

I'm in charlotte for Family and for ciaa, so I'm like why not do a breakfast with the family? I turn to my trusty advisor yelp to find suitable options! Great I see the flying biscuit!  I've been to the one in Atlanta so I can vouch for their food! Let's start with the good...  The good the mimosas, and food was good. Everyone's fav was the grits. The buttermilk pancakes are cool not the best I've had, also tried the oatmeal pancakes. They were pretty good.  The bad which takes it to 3 instead of 4/5 was the extremely slow service! The waitress was nice but the service was slow. The pancakes weren't hot when they came out and neither was the chicken sausage.  Maybe because it was a busy day for them. I'd come back if I'm the area but it's not as great as the one I went to in Atl

Teala was an amazing waitress. She knew the menu inside and out! The spot was totally clean! All of the selections were delicious. I ordered the pasta, sausage and eggs strangely amazing! The biscuits are huge and yummy!

Visited for the first time last Sunday with one of my Brunch Buddies.  The place was a little hard to find, tucked away in a big shopping center, but the long line of people waiting outside clued me in.  The line moved quickly though, and my friend and I had a table within 15 minutes.  My only real complaint was the table we were seated at.  They have a huge back patio that I am sure is amazing when the weather is nice, but that day it was rainy and chilly.  My chair was right next to the back rail of the patio and the plastic wall cover thingy didn't do the best job of keeping the cold wind and rain out.  The food, however, was amazing and the waitress was very friendly and attentive.  The salmon scramble and rosemary potatoes are to die for!  Despite being a GRIT, I have never cared much for grits, but I may have to rethink that.  Definitely going back!
Love their Hollywood omlit and turkey hash...... Getting hungry just thinking about it.  I always ask for extray cheese, place is clean and staff are always nice and accommodating.
We LOVE coming here for breakfast. It's definitely a place to come for some unique tasty breakfast.

We were looking for a handy family dinner place after swimming and the kids wanted "breakfast food" so we thought, why not Flying Biscuit for dinner?  We usually go to the one in Stonecrest but decided to go here since it was closer. Easy parking, no wait, place was about 1/2 full early Saturday evening. Vibe is similar to the other one, bright colors, diner-like atmosphere. However, this one has really bright lighting.   Kids all ordered choco milk and chocolate chip pancakes (more on this later). Both the wife and I ordered variations on the green tomato BLT - I had the sandwich, she had the salad. We also ordered the soup of the day - tomato basil bisque.   Soup was rock star good - not sure if it was the soup, the cold day, swimming or all of the above, but we devoured it! In fact, it was so good our younger son got his own bowl! Of course, the soup comes with the trademark biscuits with apple butter (which makes them for me!). When the chocolate chip pancakes arrived they were HUGE portions! These were not the kid size but the full adult size portions. We figured it was a mistake but figured it would make for a good dogie bag for tomorrow. The green tomato BLTs were very tasty, in particular the jalepeno-cashew relish that comes on top! The combo of turkey bacon, the relish, fried green tomato and goat cheese is very unusual but balanced.   While we were eating the manager came by and asked about us, mentioned the pancake thing, which we said was no big deal. We then got to talking to Brandon, who also works there. Very friendly, nice guy and we mentioned our daughter had just had her birthday. . . before you know it Brandon had ordered us a birthday brownie sunday for our table! It was also very good - dark chocolate and cream cheese brownie with ice cream, whipped cream, the whole nine yards. . . We were pleasantly surprised to say the least!  When the check arrived not only was the brownie comped, but all of our pancake orders had been reduced to kids orders!! So basically we got free desert and breakfast for three for the next day on the house. Pretty exceptional service by any standard!  Overall, we already liked Flying Biscuit but this sold us as devoted customers!

Never disappointed here! I am not sure I have had grits like these anywhere else. I certainly don't want to know the ingredients. All, I can say is that I hope you get at least 3 miles in either before or after you eat them;). Nonetheless, they are worth the sacrifice. I am NOT a breakfast fan, but I will eat it here everyday! If it was all lite of course:)

I always come here I would say 2x a month the customer service is good never had a problem before. Today was a little different so today visit only get 3 our waitress didn't come and check up on us only to give the check, didn't ask if I wanted a refill like I was literally trying to get tea from the ice in the corner of my cup lol. We were seated under the air vent so water was dripping down hitting my arm/hand so we had to move to a different table. The food was good as always, I ordered the biscuit eggs and gravy. I love the biscuits with the Apple butter. I really want the review to be 4 or 5 but we'll see what happens next time.

Not really sure how this place is still open, the flavorless breakfast is the reason I won't return. I tried it once and never again. It doesn't have a lot of normal breakfast items. I guess some people like that. 100% not the place to take your kids.

No airborne breaded goods here! (although I would be 100% behind the idea)  I met my best friend for Sunday brunch around 1:00 and was informed that there was a 10-15 minute wait. The guy who was manning the host desk had an awesome mustache and was super friendly. The wait time ended up being less than that and we were led inside.   Our sweet waitress Monique greeted us, gave us menus and took our drink orders. I had browsed the menu online beforehand but seeing all of the options in-person slightly overwhelmed me (everything sounded and looked delicious!) but I stuck with what I originally planned on ordering: the Piedmont omelet with oven roasted potatoes.
