I don't care how "dreamy" their grits are, this girl does not eat them.   The interior reminded me of a bright, cheery country kitchen. I was also surprised to learn that they have somewhat of a coffee bar serving up chai tea (iced or hot), mochas, cappuccinos, lattes, etc. I just stuck with plain ol' coffee.  After our orders were taken, our food arrived pretty soon afterward. I was pleased by the size of the biscuit. Even though they go by 'Flying Biscuit' I was half expecting them to serve biscuits that were pretty small. Not the case here. Thick, fluffy, carby goodness. On the table, you have the choice to dress your biscuit with standard butter or apple butter (or both, you rebel). I went the apple butter route and it tasted just like Fall to me.   My omelet was delicious. Packed with chicken sausage and turkey bacon, cheese, and onions. So so so so good and would order it again. Mentally, I've already added this place to my rotation of breakfast/brunch spots and cannot wait to go as often as I can get the chance.

We came for breakfast on Memorial Day and made it in just in time. The line can get really long but the food is definitely worth it.  I got the breakfast bowl and my wife got the southern style biscuit benedict. Both were absolutely delicious!!!!! Both of us were weary of getting the grits (which comes with every item) but they really are award winning like they say. The biscuits are HUGE. And I do mean huge!!  The inside is nice and cozy with a really cool big front door that is a garage door with a big screen over it. Really cool place with awesome service. You should definitely give it a try.  Oh...food was so good I didn't get to take a picture because I ate it too fast

So, so, so, so, so delicious and super duper friendly staff! I know I sound cheesy and like I am exaggerating, but seriously, I'm not.   The Flying Biscuit Cafe is such a warm and inviting cafe. Not only is the dining area welcoming with it's bright colors and natural light, the staff are extremely friendly, making you feel genuinely happy to be there.  I guess I should get to the most important part, right? THE FOOD! Surprise, surprise... IT'S AWESOME! If I can remember correctly, I ordered the vegetarian sausage, eggs and a biscuit with a side of fresh fruit. Also no surprise was that the biscuit was one of the best I have ever had. SO FLUFFY!   Overall, I had an awesome experience at The Flying Biscuit Cafe! Cool name, great food, friendly staff and great dining area. What more can I ask for?

Reading the other reviews for this Flying Biscuit locations, I see words. In fact, I see many words, such as decor, biscuits, service, grits, etc. These are all good words, and you can certainly use them to talk about the Flying Biscuit. However, when I talk about the flying biscuit, I really only need to use two words:  Turkey. Meatloaf.  Hey you guys, I am so in love with the Flying Biscuit's turkey meatloaf. I know, if you're a meatloaf lover, you'll wrinkle your nose at the idea that turkey could take the place of ground beef and pork. Well, here's some news for you: in this instance, turkey does not substitute. It surpasses.  OK, OK, I don't want to write a simplistic review, so here are some other facts: the decor is interesting, the clientele is even more interesting, and the service is sometimes good, sometimes iffy.  But oh, turkey meatloaf. Those are the words you need to note.

If you're starving then I suppose you could eat here otherwise I'd steer clear you'll spend $32 on essentially food that is bland Coffee is disgusting in all the meals on the menu are either really weird or don't offer the right combination of items for a good brunch

One of my fave breakfast spots in the city! Staff is always friendly, and food is ALWAYS good! Food always taste fresh, like they actually care about the quality. They also have quite a bit of healthy options as well. Their grits are so freaking Goooood!! LOL!! Love this spot! Highly recommend!

New favorite breakfast spot. I love the park plaza in general and coming here makes it even better. Considering how busy it was on a Sunday we got seated really quickly. Teala our amazing waitress was so fast and so amazing. She ROCKED!!!!! The two tables next to us also loved her. Our food was AMAZING. Just overall an amazing place.  The two tables around us and our table got our food so fast. The food is also super amazing.

I thought the shrimp quesadilla was fabulous. However, the meal was surprisingly disappointing. I had the blackened tilapia on grits which was not very flavorful.  However, the fish was very fresh. The unsweetened ice tea was very good and the service was wonderful. Prices are very reasonable.

BREAKFAST ALL DAY.  I've only had breakfast items here and quality and service are always phenomenal.  Those biscuits are lovely, yes, but DO NOT miss the grits. The 'loaded' grits at this place are crazy-good!  I like that they offer turkey sausage and veggie items (tofu is on the menu), if you're vegetarian or just in the mood for a meatless meal.  Bring an appetite.  Portions are generous, and the food is very flavorful.  Sure, this isn't your run-of-the-mill standard bargain breakfast (most brek entrees with tax are around ten bucks), but it's worth it.  I keep saying I'm going to try some of the other menu items, but breakfast is just TOO good...

They have the best grits in town, in my opinion. However, there other menu items are often flavorless or overcooked. My biscuit was dry and bland, very dense and not fluffy like a good biscuit should be. Also the service tends to be hit or miss. But for the price, it's ok and they do offer a good bit of healthy fare.

We've been to another Flying Biscuit and weren't that impressed.  However, after trying the Shrimp & Grits at a Yelp event, we decided to give it another go at this other location.  We stopped in to get a small bowl but wait, what?  The ONLY way to order the Shrimp & Grits is as a $12.99 dinner entree? Oh, you get a side and a biscuit.  Fine.  Ordered the Tomato Basil soup, which was meh, way too thick and obviously reheated since when I tried it, it was cold, and when daughter tried it, it was too hot.  We ended up sharing the giant bowl of Shrimp & Grits, but we both agreed they were not nearly as good as what we remembered from the Yelp Event.   We brought home what we didn't eat there, but neither one of us was that interested in eating anymore.
The food was GREAT here! Loved the biscuits, grits on point waffles everything good... our waiter was fast and attentive!

Used to LOVE this place as they offer great tofu options and fabulous biscuits, but my husband and I began noticing how salty the food is. We mentioned it to our servers over a few months, but our food continued to taste over-salted. We'll still stop by occasionally, but it's no longer a favorite spot.

Delicious food. I work crazy hours, from 3am-1pm, so I've tried many different breakfast places in the Charlotte area. This is one of my favorite restaurants for breakfast. Biscuits are incredible, especially w/ their apple butter sauce. My only (small) gripe is their price. Expect to pay about $9-10 per plate for breakfast. But that's the cost of having fresh, non-greasy food!

I know this is going to be wildly unpopular, but I don't understand the hype of this place. It's a cute breakfast/lunch/brunch spot that's located in the Park Road Shopping center -- so there's plenty of parking (that's a plus!). Another plus, was despite it being a beautiful fall day there was no wait! We walked right in and were seated in the back covered area.  I came with my husband and parents when they were in town during the fall. I ordered the seasonal soup. It was a squash soup with actually really delicious croutons. The soup was creamy without being too heavy, but it was a little on the sweet side.   What totally miffed me ... the biscuits. They were hard as a rock on the outside and crumbled easily. I didn't think they were flavorful. I've read other reviews that were positive so maybe I was there on an of day.  Service was OK, not great, not awful.   I'll have to try it again and see if it was just an off day for the restaurant, but I was truly disappointed by the biscuit.

The Flying Biscuit is a nice breakfast joint mired in horrible quality control and poor customer service.  We came in around 10:30a on a weekday to find a nice atmosphere and a half full dining area. Their menu has a good spread of healthier options like chicken sausages and turkey bacon, and listed many items as gluten free. I ordered the turkey hash, excited to try both their "famous" biscuit and moon dusted potatoes. My mother ordered the buttermilk blueberry pancakes.  After a short while, our food was delivered. The turkey hash was different, although it made for a good breakfast option with the savory turkey and gravy over the potatoes. The famous biscuit was fresh, but really just a good biscuit, nothing that would inspire you to order a dozen. The potatoes were also just well done potatoes. They had good seasoning without being salty, but didn't really blow me away. I did think that overall, the dish could have benefited from not having cheddar cheese melted on top of the eggs. It didn't add to the overall flavor of the dish and served only to make the dish unnecessarily "heavier" and overcook my requested over-easy eggs (which I was warned might happen from the waitress).   Now, from this review so far you're asking me "why only 1 star if everything was ok?" Well, when my mother's food came out the problems unfolded.  First, the waitress mistakenly ordered plain buttermilk pancakes instead of the blueberry pancakes. Fine, mistakes happen. But when asked about it, she first responded by saying "you said just buttermilk" in an accusatory and annoyed tone. When we all corrected her, she gave a halfhearted apology and attitude and asked if she could exchange it. Not wanting to be a hassle, my mother said it was ok, but just to get her some fresh blueberries to put on top.   Now... drum roll please, for the moment you've all been waiting for. After a little while, our server came by with the blueberries. Just when my mother was about to pour them over her pancakes, she noticed something; some little white spots dotted around the bowl. Weird, so she picked out one blueberry, and then another and then another until it became painfully clear that all of the blueberries in the bowl had MOLD on them (pic attached). And I don't just mean a little mold on one or two blueberries, I mean A WHOLE BOWL OF MOLDY BLUEBERRIES. I can see it now, Gordon Ramsey taking that bowl of living fungi and once living fruit, mushing his fingers into it and screaming "YOU'RE GONNA KILL SOMEBODY!" Likewise, at the same time, I wanted to warn everyone in the restaurant that the blueberries had been contaminated not only with visibly growing mold, but also the spores of all that mold (trust me, I've worked in a lab and mold spores are no joke).  As if I need to justify my problem with this even more, imagine being served that mess, cooked inside your pancakes unknowingly. This was a complete and blatant lack of quality control. The kitchen staff and manager had those rotting blueberries stocked, and then sent them out in a bowl where the waitress, without looking, served it to a customer for consumption. Again, in the words of Gordon Ramsey himself: YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED.   ITS EVEN BLUEBERRY SEASON! WE LITERALLY JUST PICKED SOME FRESH!  When pointed out to the waitress that the blueberries were moldy and rotting, she gave a simple apology filled with her typical bad attitude and whisked the bowl away. Another lady came by after and simply offered another apology about the "mistake". No offer to comp the plate of a mere $6 short stack of pancakes, no further apology or explanation offered. No attempt was made to make this right. At that point, we were discarded as valued customers. The bill came and we were charged full price for our "wonderful" meal. Wow. I'm surprised they didn't charge us extra for the mold.

Great breakfast spot in the Park Road Shopping Center.  We first came here by accident and were very pleased with the vegan options!  I can't seem to deviate from my order because it's was good the first time... tofu scramble with a side of the black bean cakes.  They go so well together!  My husband likes the vegan bbq wrap or veganizes the mexican wrap.

This place is great for breakfast. The grits here is almost as good as the grits that my mother made. I had the Piedmont omelette with potatoes and it was awesome. The service from our server, Tesla, was wonderful and the rest of the staff seem to like working here. It gets packed on the weekends so get here early.
Shrimp and grits was very good. Salad was not over dressed. Good service. Overall, one of the better Biscuits I've been to.

So who doesn't like delicious fresh made biscuits? No one? That's what I thought. I adore this place. The food is wonderful and probably my favorite place to come for breakfast - not brunch although they do brunch the crowd the mimosas all of it - but breakfast for me this is the spot.  The turkey hash breakfast and the  eggs-stroidinary eggs (gosh spelling cannot be right on this item but I am too lazy to google it at the moment) are my faves for sure.  I love the funky décor on the inside and the fact that they have a few tables for outside seating as well. The portions are huge and every item I have had thus far is full of flavor. The coffee is ok but not the best ive had but hey its coffee and pretty much all coffee makes me happy.  I always bring my mom here when she comes in town its one of her favorites as well. The service is good and by good I mean they come they get your order and they don't mess it up. No frills and at times it seems I cant tell who the server is per say since we always get waited on by multiple people every time we come. I like it and we all leave happy. Kudos Flying Biscuit! Its always amazing and cant wait to return!

OMG....those damn biscuits are phenomenal. A small piece fell off when I was cutting it in half so I got to sample it before I really got into it. I mean, it was to die for. I made the ugly face. I decided to wrap some up in a tissue and stick in my purse. No, I'm joking. I took two in a to-go container and ate one for breakfast the next morning. I mean, what place sells biscuits dense enough to eat for breakfast with a cup of coffee and be good??? I mean, I was good! With ONE biscuit!   I had the shrimp and grits and they weren't really all that. It was just shrimp, grits (which were amazing) and a whole bunch of stewed tomatoes. I'm used to shrimp and grits with onions, peppers and sausage. There were more tomatoes than there were grits and shrimp. I pushed most of them to the side of my plate  and, by the end of my meal, it looked like I still had half a plate of food left. Nope...it was just tomatoes.   Anyway, this seems like just a regular a** breakfast spot with good a** biscuits.
Just as great as the one in Ballantyn, but much closer to where I live. Can't help myself to grab a half dozen biscuits to go.....LOVE IT!!

Three words: try the grits. Even if you don't like grits, try them anyway. This is the second time I've got the Southern Style Biscuit Benedict and it has not disappointed either time, even for a critical food lover. Biscuit, amazing homemade pimento cheese, bacon, poached eggs, hollandaise sauce with fresh basil. So much going on and it all works! Whether you're from the south or just visiting, get an accurate taste of southern comfort food with love and get it. Also, as everyone else says, the apple butter is amazing.

Loved it!  Stopped by to pick up lunch to go with my daughter.  While I was perusing the menu through the window, a busboy stepped outside to hand me a takeout menu.  How nice!  I settled on the chicken club wrap.  It was served with the most amazing diced potatoes and a huge biscuit.  All for $8.  I shared it with my daughter and still had half a sandwich left to eat today for leftovers.  I also ordered an iced chai.  It was not so good... a little watered down, but not so bad that I had them make me another.  Next time I will just stick with a sweet tea.    I plan to bring all the kiddos here for breakfast - the breakfast menu looked amazing.  So excited to have this fun, fast, yummy restaurant close by!

"Oooooo, I wanna come back," I said to myself as I read through the menu. There was so much good-sounding stuff I wanted to try, and I felt away about not being able to sample it this one time.   Nevertheless, I settled on the Hollywood omelet. This healthier option is a veggie omelet with cheese. It comes with fruit (but I substituted the fruit for grits) and a biscuit. I also ordered the 'creamiest dreamiest grits'.  The omelet was rather large, I couldn't finish it all. It was a little watery, but I blame the spinach inside of it. It wasn't bad , at all and the tomato coulis went VERY well with the omelet...I kind of want that on all my omelets now.  The grits were creamy, delicious, and maybe had a little bit of cheese mixed in, which was good. I wish the portion of grits was bigger. The biscuit was good as well, it was definitely fluffy. Not the greasy, super salty Bojangles biscuit that leaves your fingertips glistening. These are drier, for lack of a better term and I was getting a flour-like aftertaste...and yet it didn't stop me from spreading the signature cranberry apple butter on top and eating it.   Very much looking forward to coming and back and trying the dishes with chicken sausage, and maybe some of the French toast.

My family and I love The Flying Biscuit. It is suitable for diners of all ages and palates. The menu is extremely diverse and offers everything from light and healthy fare to hearty comfort food. Many breakfast joints serve dishes that are dripping in oil and heavily salted while The Flying Biscuit delivers flavorful and quality food that is not too heavy or greasy. Portion sizes are generous AND delicious. Love this place and can't wait to come back next time I am in town.
This place is really delicious! Food was fresh and very yummy. Staff was great.  Will be back!

Food was okay, but my review may be biased since I've been to other flying biscuits that taste better. But, more importantly, the customer service was not the best. When I ordered just the single stack pancake(the lowest costing item on the menu), she waitress seemed pretty upset and kept encouraging my friend and I to purchase more. After that, she didn't come back and check up on us at all. She then gave us our bill while we were not even half way done with our food, and didn't show up again until much later (keep in mind, it was not busy). She tossed the bill back and just left after we paid. She was not given a tip.

This is the first review I have done on yelp. I could resist to let everyone else know how amazing this place is! I went with 3 other people and we all got something different. With that being said all 4 dishes were great! There was a wait on a Sunday morning but it wasn't too long. I highly recommend the southern style eggs Benedict!
I had the best breakfast while i was at North Carolina. I loved the mocha i had it was amazing .
We have been here twice, Solid good Comfort food for Breakfast. Great Service and good selection on the menu. We will definitely be back again, hopefully when it's not quite as busy!

I saw turkey bacon on the menu and was so excited because very few places offer turkey bacon! I order the turkey burger w/ a side of dusted moon potatoes (yuck) very cold and dry! back to the dusty burger, I was so disappointed never in my life have I ever eaten a frozen turkey burger until the flying biscuit eewww the meat was shaped funny and tasted really rancid the lettuce was so big an wet I didn't notice the barely there grey tb patty there was some kind of splash of sauce on the humongous wheat bun I instantly scrapped it off with the napkin! I said a prayer and proceeded... Since I'd scrapped off the evil sauce I thought I'd use what I thought was H57 ketchup ... ... All I'm gonna say is idk what they used to refill those ketchup bottles but that was not H57 or ketchup for that matter it was uber rancid never tasted anything like it  the flying biscuit really let me down guys I was excited 3,000 miles before I arrived mission unsatisfactory

Mmm Vegan BBQ Tofu burrito. Grits are freaking delicious. Biscuit did not fly, but was very soft and sweet. Typically packed on a weekend late morning/afternoon. Waiters are quick and friendly. Decorations are amusing. Large portions, omelettes are pretty large.  Maybe I'll make a biscuit fly next time.

The food here was great. This was my first time coming here. I ordered the salmon scramble with their grits and it was great! The grits were creamy and delicious. Our server was Mason and he was wonderful.  He was very attentive to us and other tables as well. I appreciated the great customer service.  I will definitely come back here again.
Omg the food was so good!! I got the breakfast bowl and it was yummy!! The grits were so great!! I also got a Sid of collar greens and I was prefect!! Will definitely go again and try something else

4.5 stars!  This was one of my favorite places to eat.  My manager and I stopped in for breakfast.  I opted for the Smoked Salmon Scramble with Dill Cream Cheese and Creamy Grits.  YUM!    The biscuit was "AHHHH-MAZING".  I ate the biscuit LAYER by LAYER.  Delicious!

Went there Sunday for breakfast at 10:30AM and there was a line for a table but we went straight to the counter and got seating there immediately.  The two of us shared a fantastic crazy breakfast (I hate normal breakfast food) of the spinach pasta dish.  It was a crazy mix of penne pasta, cooked fresh spinach, cheese and spicy sausage - SOOOO GOOD!!!  Came with huge biscuit with applebutter and fab grits.  We shared and were charged a small splitting fee (I think it was two dollars) and they gave us an extra biscuit so we didnt have to split that.  More than enough food - we could barely finish our meals.  The waitstaff is young and unattentive (had to ask for refills on coffee and the check).  But the food is worth it!!!

Honestly the food is somewhat edible compared to other restaurants in Charlotte but definitely leaning towards the lower end of things. On top of that the customer service was horrible, there were three other people that received their food before us. Then for some strange reason we kept getting stared at by several people that worked there. The whole experience was very uncomfortable. Also I saw one of the waiters laughing at me once I voiced my concerns to management..

We were looking for a quick bite before a long road trip and discovered The Flying Biscuit. One of my friends in our party of 3 is vegetarian/almost vegan and she was thrilled to find a place that had a menu where she had a lot of choices. They offer soysage and lots of other health food options. I don't know much about grits being from the North, but these grits were amazing. So amazing, that my friend ordered a side of them after trying mine. The server was super fast and super friendly, we had no issues even with our special requests and substitutions.  The biscuit itself wasn't super buttery/greasy like most biscuits; it was real good.  All-in-all this place was a win, especially if you're looking for healthier/vegetarian options!

Come with an empty stomach, because probs here are large (too large in my opinion, as 3 of our 4 person party threw away half of our meals with nowhere to keep leftovers on vacation). As far as menu choices, there is something for everyone. If you come often enough and venture out of your comfort zone, you'll discover a new favorite during every visit. The French toast with raspberry drizzle is a family favorite. I always ask for extra raspberry sauce on the side and split it between my French toast and biscuit. It's delicious on the biscuit! The chicken sausage has a bit of a kick, as a warning to all who aren't fans of somewhat fiery food. There is a lot of salt and butter in the grits, which is likely why it tastes so amazing. My husband likes to drizzle a little maple syrup on his grits, but I prefer it as is. I was with a party of 10, and everyone enjoyed their breakfast. When you top off the excellent food with exemplary service and a nice ambiance, you simply can't go wrong.

My, My, My....we need one of these in my local area. We went around 10 on a Saturday morning and were seated really fast. Everything we tried here was GREAT. I went with high flyer breakfast, which consist of eggs, grits, an oatmeal pancake, chicken sausage, and a biscuit. The grits were unlike any I have had before, and we're delicious. I see why call them creamy dreamy. The oatmeal pancake was different and tasted good as well. The grilled mac and cheese was also really good also when I sampled. The service was good, nothing spectacular but no complaints. The prices are very reasonable here for the amount of food and quality that you get. The Flying Biscuit hit the spot!

I have tried the Flying Biscuit at different locations and I usually enjoy the food very much. However, my recent experience at this location was below average. The french toast was very dry and I almost wondered if it was just toast versus french toast. The potatoes that came with the omelette entree were very salty and I was unable to finish it. Not impressed with this location.

Do not go during lunch. The waitress spent all of her time on one table and left the other ones out to dry. The food was room temperature and the potatoes were cold. The services was the worst service that I have had in a long time. I will not eat there again.

An absolutely awesome breakfast experience. I met a few friends here and I was amazed at the food and service. I don't want to say it too loud but this breakfast is kicking moms old fashion Saturday mornings from the past to a close second. Keep up the great work.

Three cheers for another brunch food place!!!  I have been to other Flying Biscuit Cafes before and there is a reason for the wait.  This location in Park Road Shopping Center was just as yummy!  I arrived late Sunday morning.  The massive amount of people standing outside was a bit deceiving, since the wait was only 20 minutes...but the inside was deceivingly large!  You would never be able to tell from the small outside entrance.  The host and waitress were both very pleasant.  Service in getting our food was really slow, but the waitress kept the coffee flowing and was checking in on us.  She tried and I'm sure they were backed up in the kitchen, but a 30 minute wait for food after our order was placed was a bit much.  Once we got the food, it was great.  My eggs, sausage and potatoes were cooked perfectly.  I also got a short stack of chocolate chip pancakes, which came with two large pancakes.  Yeah, so I may have gone a bit overboard...don't judge.  With all that being said (and all that food being consumed), the winner was certainly the biscuit.  There is a reason this word is in their name.  Biscuits were CLEARLY made from scratch, super huge and were slightly sweet with sugar dusted on top.  I could probably just come back for the biscuit, but I'm definitely going to eat my way through the menu on Saturday and Sunday mornings.  Word to the wise...GO EARLY!!!

Maybe it was the time of the day (2:00p) or the reviews were so awesome but I can't say I fell in love.  The food came out really, really quickly but that meant my appetizers, biscuits, salad and entree all came within 3 minutes of each other.  The black bean cakes tasted like black beans mashed into cakes.  I had such high anticipation for the biscuit was it was more doughy than flaky and buttery.  The apple butter that came with it was unremarkable.  My oven fried chicken was dry.  My mac and cheese kinda tasted like it came from a cafeteria and the collards were tasteless.  My friend's shrimp and grits were okay but can't say she finished much of her plate.  Must say, I've had much better brunch!

Flying Biscuit is huge and the place is packed.  The popularity is deserved.  Flying Biscuit ain't perfect, but there is a lot to like.  It is a new wave cool "light" approach to Southern basics.  Out with the pork. In with the chicken and turkey.  More salads. Cappucino if you want it.  But this is still Southern food, through and through.   Everything comes with a biscuit, and it is one big fat filling biscuit.  You will waddle out of there just from the biscuit, never mind the ton of other stuff that is on your plate.  It is not my favorite biscuit on the planet - but it is in the top half definitely.  Crumbles more than I like, and not meant to have that much taste.  (It is for your gravy, your poached egg or for the apple butter that is on every table).  I scarfed mine down plenty fast, so my objections could not have been that serious.  My main dish was a fried egg salad.  (Yup, this is the new light cuisine, not Grama's southern).  The salad had two huge slices of turkey bacon, two fried eggs, moondusted potatoes, chipotle aioli AND balsamic vinaigrette on my greens.  Salad? You betcha. Italian supermodel wisp food? No way!  I loved the combo.   Fried egg salads? Their time has come. You can give those to me anytime.  The ingredients themselves? They ranged from A to B+.  Turkey bacon may be lighter than bacon bacon - but this is North Carolina.  Legendary food comes from pigs. It does not come from turkeys.  Moondusted potatoes were pleasant and there was some sort of spice to them. I am still not sure what moondust is, but the sauteing was nice.  The fried eggs? Perfect for a salad. Stayed firm on top of the salad but the yolk covered all the salad leaves nicely. Thumbs up here.  My wife's salmon and eggs were perfectly fine.  This place is not for vegans or for people trying to lose weight.  Everything has cheese, or butter, or gravy with milk.  Servings are massive; food is hearty.  Chicken sausage is still sausage   (and if you are doing sausage anyway, pork sausage is oh-so-good).  But I rolled out of Flying Biscuit pretty happy.   I was too full to walk, so my wife had to roll me out like a barrel.  (Okay, I just lied, but I was both full - and full of calories - no doubt about that.)   When I am back in Carolina, I will continue my search for the perfect breakfast -   and the perfect biscuit.   That breakfast will involve actual pork, no question on that front.   But I would not object to another meal or six at the Flying Biscuit.  The place has its charms.

I had been dying to try this place and finally did when I needed to kill some time before work one Friday morning. After all of the stellar reviews I have read, I have to say I was a little underwhelmed and slightly disappointed at my experience.  It was definitely busy, but I did not have to wait for a table as it sounds like it's much busier on the weekends then during the week.    The service was not great by any means, as it took at least 10 minutes for someone to even notice I had sat down and was waiting for any kind of service... a water and wait would have been fine, but not so much the case.  Once I finally got someone's attention to come to my table, I went ahead and ordered drinks and food as I didn't want to be sitting there who knows how long till they came back.  My food did come quickly, but my table didn't have butter or jam like every other table did so it took me a good 5 minutes to get someone's attention to tell them, the lady looked at me and said ok (fairly annoyed)... she never came back.  She actually went behind the bar area and started talking to another waiter.  I got so annoyed that I got up and walked to a table several tables away and snagged some jam and butter off of there.  To be honest if this review was based off of service they would get a one star.  Ok enough about the service you're really worried about the food, so here. we. go.... I went with the traditional flying biscuit breakfast (I think it's the first choice on the menu). Eggs, sausage, grits and biscuit.  Eggs were made as requested and hot when they came out. The chicken sausage was ok, it was in patty form and was a bit chewy. The biscuit was more on the sweet side with the colored sugar sprinkled on top. I'm more a fan of the savory/buttery biscuits, opposed to sweet ones; however with that being said it was perfectly baked, the texture, the flakey layers, etc... it was baked to perfection, I will give them that! Finally the cheesy grits that are a big ta da around these parts... they were very yummy, I enjoyed them. Can't say they were my favorite but I can see why people enjoy them. Overall I'm going to say it was just OK.  I liked the atmosphere good music and open floor space brought a lively feel to the restaurant.  Seemed like there was some limited but additional seating towards the back.  There is a bar so you can enjoy your adult beverages for brunch with your meal!  They had so many other options, like scrambles and such that were pretty unique so I think I'll go a little more off the beaten path next time I come back on the food side!

Omg!! Was I lucky to have a cancelled flight that resulted in my staying overnight in Charlotte! I needed to find breakfast and I found love! The flying biscuit was a vegetarian dream for breakfast! The place was packed, though. It was bright and colorful and the tables are arranged to get the most out of the space so don't try to take a really big group there because you'll need to wait. I ordered the pancake of the day; had nuts and bananas, along with the tofu scramble, creamy grits and of course a fluffy biscuit with a side of apple butter! I was so upset I was on a time crunch and didn't have time to eat everything but baby... it was all so good! The grits were thick enough to hold on your spoon and creamy and rich. The tofu scramble had fresh peppers and onions and some kind of seasoning or marinade that tied it all together, perfectly! The biscuit?? The biscuit was about four or five inches high! The apple butter was the perfect condiment for it, too! How did they know?? I barely finished the pancake, as it was as big as the plate it came on! I have no friends or family in Charlotte, so I don't know when I'll be back, but whenever I am fortunate enough to be near this place, I plan to fill up, Flying Biscuit style!
The coffee was hot. All coffee drinkers know what I mean. The food was seasoned to perfection. The service is great, very attentive. If you are a breakfast person yu will love this place.
Always extremely friendly! My girlfriend and I go here every Sunday before church. They have THE best biscuits you'll ever have and they are vegetarian and vegan friendly :)

This was my first time here, but definitely not my last!!!! Went there on a Sunday - so prime-time for brunch crowd. The wait for a table of two was not long. I don't even think it was 20mins.   Atmosphere: Very eclectic decor and fast pace. Lots of people talking, staff moving around. Quirky art-work on the walls. I like!  Food. Went there with a friend and we couldn't decide what to get for the longest time. Well, while waiting to be seated I had my mind set on something, which I totally didn't order.  I had the Biscuits, Eggs and Gravy. Oh boy! My friend raved about their homemade chicken sausage, but I was craving savory gravy at first didn't realize it had bits of chicken sausage in it until it came out....yes it does state on the menu *facepalm*. Total win, when my plate arrived! Those biscuits are worth all the hype! I was thinking of perhaps ordering a side to bring home, but nooo, got to lay low on the carbs! Maybe i'll bring some home now for thanksgiving :) I'm new to the world of "Grits", I liked their grits, wouldn't know what "bad" ones would taste like though.   I ordered water and coffee. The staff were attentive and refilled before I even noticed it was getting low. Plus points! Our waiter was super friendly and told us not to forget their homemade butter! Delish!  My friend ordered the Egg-stravaganza. My original pick was to try their french toast, but yah! didn't order, so my friend was nice enough to have me taste hers. The french toast topped with  homemade raspberry sauce and honey crème anglaise was good. They used whole-wheat toast. As a spoiled new yorker who loves diners, I was hoping for thick challah bread for the french-toast, but the whole wheat made this tasty dish sound healthy...even just a little.  Loved our whole brunch experience and will definitely come back! only star deduction because parking sucks a little - acknowledging it was brunch rush-hour, still...come early - park safer, none of those crazies that zoom through the lot.

Not only is the service always on point but our food never ever disappoints. A definite go to is the customary biscuit and Applebutter which I could swim in a pool of, it is THAT good. The macaroni and cheese here is among the best I have ever had, home cooked or restaurant quality and nothing beats their breakfast food. Our food is always served hot and with minimal wait. The staff is very accommodating even during busy times. You've got to try the Eggstravaganza, the creamy dreamy grits & moon dusted potatoes are truly out of this world.

I love the Flying Biscuit.  It has a great Neighborhood Joint feel to it and it is consistent.  My wife and I have been in groups of 5+ and I've been by myself for a quick lunch.  We have been there for an early breakfast, late lunch or with the serious weekend rush at 10am on a Saturday morning.   The staff is always polite and the kitchen turns the food around quickly.  I tend to order the same thing every time and it's like they have a Xerox machine back there... the dish comes out the same every time.  The food is pretty standard diner fare, with a few signature items.  The biscuits, of course, are special.  They are HUGE and lean more towards a shortcake to me (add some macerated strawberries and fresh cream... serious desert opportunity here, FBC!) but they are very tasty and always fresh.  There is a delicious cranberry apple butter (made in-house) on the table that goes perfectly w/ the biscuits.  Their grits are also outstanding... one of the few places where I enjoy grits.

Our waiter, James, totally ignored us. We were a group of seven - after getting us water, we were basically forgotten. We got coffee - eventually. We got cream - eventually. We had to ask him after 30-45 minutes if we could order. He brought us our order, but didn't return to ask how anything was. My friend was out of coffee for almost the entire meal. The foodrunners and host did a better job than this waiter.  I had the pumpkin french toast with biscuits - oh, and James didn't bring us any jam for our biscuits, either (guess this should be renamed The PLAIN Biscuit) - and while the food was all right, it absolutely did not warrant the huge line outside when we left. All in all, we sat there for almost two hours - this was not due to any extra chatting on our part, it just took that long for James to get his act together.  I won't be suggesting this when my friends and I go out for brunch... and we LOVE brunch!

I would definitely come back here. The food is great, I had there pumpkin pancakes and a biscuit with gravy and both were awesome. There service decent but they forgot my silverware and there wasn't enough sugar on the table. Both fixable things. There coffee is medium  in strength which is better then most. They will also cook to order which is great. I don't eat much and I hate wasting food so I was able to order a single pancake and a single biscuit.  Over all I do recommend it.

This would be my only breakfast spot if I lived in Charlotte!  The food, service, atmosphere, attentiveness, and overall vibe here is phenomenal.   Our server was so knowledgeable about the menu and helpful in crafting the perfect breakfast plate.   The grits are definitely special! The chicken sausage is the best I've ever had!!  Go here... Thank me later.
YUM YUM YUM! This is one of my favorite places to have brunch and when my parents are in town they always insist on going here.

Went for breakfast on Memorial Day! It was busy, but we only had to wait about 15 minutes for a table! Was a little disappointed to see things like chicken sausage, soysage, turkey bacon, and tofu on the menu.. Not really into all that hipster stuff! Ended up getting the Southern Egg Scramble, which was really good! The grits was by far the best I've ever had! Service was decent, but our server was very rushed and busy. I would go back for the grits!

The menu selection is huge and there are many items I would want to come back and try, such as the blueberry pancakes and chicken scramble with roasted red peppers and feta cheese.  I settled on the eggs benedict and the unusual ingredient was the pimento cheese, which added a nice punch of flavor, and I loved the turkey bacon.  I agree with other reviewers though on the biscuit, considering it's the namesake it was.....just okay (a little too dry at the ends).  My pumpkin latte was a nice treat.

So this WAS my time trying out this restaurant. I was NOT HAPPY!! I only went there because it was next to the bakery. YOU KNOW WHAT GOT( GETS) UNDER SKIN?? WHEN I HAND SOMEONE MY CARD OR MONEY IN THEIR HAND AND THE PUT MY CHANGE OR CARD ON THE COUNTER!!! It's customer service 101!!! I'm standing right there hand it to me in my hand THE SAME WAY I GIVE IT TO YOU!!   THE PHONE CALL: I ordered over the phone, the lady who take my order was nice. She helped me with the food prices and other questions I had  THE PICK UP: Well all I can say was I felt rushed. I guess she was busy... no one helped her out ..WHAT HAPPEN TO TEAM WORK! Plus she put my money on the counter   THE FOOD: I ordered the Vegan Tofu BBQ wrap... I must have asked for extra salt times 3!! The wrap would have been good it was just to SALTY!! My co-worker order  the chicken salad that is $10 bucks ... well her salad looked like a side salad with chicken. My side with my Vegan Tofu was a salad... WHICH I HAD MORE MY SALAD THEN MY CO-WORKER AND HERS WAS A MEAL NOT A SIDE SALAD!!
James is a wonderful server! Great food, fat service, never an empty glass or cup, and so nice! Travis is another favorite! Everything tastes great. Casual for kids!

Oh I have found the mecca of breakfast. On my quest to fill my grumbling tummy, I stumbled upon this gem. Tucked away in the Park Road Shopping center, the beast called Hunger was slated. After indulging in the Southern Scramble, eggs scrambled with spicy Collard greens and turkey Bacon, I will be scribbling sonnets about their creamy dreamy grits.

So I was visiting North Carolina and even though I have friends who lived here they still wanted me to chose where to eat ? Lol so I was scrolling and the name caught my eye. So we come here and it's really upbeat welcoming and colorful. I got the eggs Benedict and it was delicious!! I wish they had a place like this near me!

Visited on 1/28 with a party of 3. It's always super crowded, but they get you seated in a timely manner.   Two of us ordered the salmon scrambled and one ordered sausage, eggs, grits and French toast. I would recommend this place to anyone. The staff is friendly and the food is good.

Apparently there are two of these restaurants and this rating is for this one. Creative culinary creations are sure to satisfy everyone. Breakfast served all day and the atmosphere is very chill for a strip mall restaurant.

They are billed as the home of the creamiest dreamiest grits and they do not disappoint. The service is awesome and if you wander in lost and not sure what to get their delicious menu and well educated staff can help you out. This is a definite go to place for breakfast, brunch or lunch.
Absolutely LOVE it!! One of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. Seriously everything I've eaten has been great!

Came here on a whim... relocating to NC and wanted to check out the local fare... place was packed (expected for a Sunday) waiting wasn't too bad and our server, Ken? From Ohio (is what I can remember) was great.  He was clearly slammed with other tables and customers but when he did get to us, he was pleasant.  Food was ok... a bit heavy and rich for me but can understand why it's a local favorite.

Had a really great breakfast experience here recently. They have outdoor tables, so you can enjoy some wonderful al fresco dining. The place itself is quite colorful, spacious, and comfortably designed, and the food was fantastic. I ordered the scrambled eggs, and it came with a healthy dose of turkey bacon, as well as grits and an absolutely delicious, fresh from the oven biscuit (which covered with apple butter is even better), and an oatmeal pancake with peach compote. It was all-around delicious and an incredibly satisfying, reasonably-priced breakfast. My only complaint would be that it took a while to get and to process the check, but I guess I'll overlook that given how generally satisfying I thought the experience was.

This place is amazing! My fiance said "it's like they asked me what I wanted to eat and put it on the menu".  If you are not a beef or pork eater this is the perfect place!  A lot of their items are made with turkey.  Finally!!! I know it's the south, but it seems like  beef and pork, especially bacon have been forced on the public by the producers.  Anywho, the food is amazing, and worth the 30 minute drive from our house.

If you haven't been to the Biscuit yet, you have done yourself a great disservice. I have been here about a hundred times and have had just about everything on the menu and I never had a bad meal here. The steak and eggs are nothing short of phenomenal and the biscuits are out of this world. Run, don't walk to the Biscuit for breakfast. Make sure to get there early, or you'll find yourself waiting in a long line!  This place lives up to the hype.
omg!!! this place is awesome! food is amazing. it is a must. our server taylor she was awesome as well. it was our first time here and the experience was great. we will be back.

So....my experience was ok! Let me say first that the grits...the grits! Those grits were good... heavenly indeed! There are lots of good breakfast options, but a bit expensive for the quality. The flying biscuits biscuit is actually nice too, unlike anything I've had anywhere else, flaky and different to the regular biscuits you get for breakfast. Besides that, everything else was mediocre. The dusted potatoes were overdone and so hard we could not finish them. The eggs reminded me of stuff that is made without real eggs...not worth what I paid...I could not finish those either. Let's just say I was a bit disappointed, but if all I was going to have were grits...that's what I'll be getting!

I was visiting from out of town and stopped by due to the advice of a person I sat next to on the plane, who made the biscuits sound magically delicious. The place was packed out the door. So considering the amount of people waiting for a seat, the wait time was actually not bad. Service is quick and efficient but understandably they have no time for chitchat.  I am from Texas, so although our southern BBQ is kick ass, I don't believe there is expertise in making proper grits. It's always been bland, pale,and well, gritty. I had to know what the fuss is about! I got the shrimp and grits with biscuit. Ermagerd, I am now enlightened to the Southern pride associated with grits done right. It was creamy,smooth, and rich without being heavy at all. And no grittiness! I could taste a touch of butter and cheese, but it was the perfect balance to still keep me shoveling in for another heaping spoon. The tomato topping left little pools of oil which I scooped aside, but the shrimp was also done well. Shrimp is so often overlooked, but these remained juicy and tender. And the biscuit was yet another ermagerd moment. Its denseness was along the lines of a scone, but it somehow was fluffy and airy and so moist. Tearing it open is a thing of joy. The edges had a nice crisp and was lightly buttery. Only odd thing to me is it was sprinkled with sugar for a savory dish. But that could easily be scraped off. These were actually finger lickin' good. Next time I'm in town, I have my eye on the pot pie.
It's just as delicious as everyone says! Try the fried chicken and the shrimp and grits!
Fast service and delicious food!! Came for Sunday breakfast on our way back up to DC after a Panthers game and it totally hit the spot!!

This proves 5 stars is impossible on Yelp because this place deserves 5+.   Perfect scratch made food, great atmosphere (busy but spacious), and excellent friendly service!    We had a perfect Sunday breakfast and got coffees to go at no additional charge!

Went to this place for an early dinner (4pm) yesterday and had a nice experience. Our waitress was very cheerful and attentive, and the decor is comfy while being bright :)  We split the black bean cakes w/ feta, onions and tomatillo sauce and they were ok - the patties are not cooked in any way, which I wasn't expecting.  I ordered the Fried Green Tomato BLT with a side salad and it was very good. I did have to ask for some of their Red Pepper Aioli sauce to add some ZING to my sandwich but the side salad's balsamic was one of the best I've ever had! My friend got the shrimp quesadilla and it didn't look impressive to me, but he said it was good.  Overall, I'd go back to try a biscuit at least! :)
We were told a 15 minute wait and it was almost an hour to get seated, and then almost 30 minutes to get food. Food was pretty good but service sucks.

I ordered the southern style biscuit benedict with a side of creamy dreamy grits which were both fantastic. The biscuit comes cut in half and each topped with a poached egg, pimento cheese, turkey bacon, hollandaise sauce and garnished with basil. I would most definitely order this again. The biscuit was fluffy and flaky. Nothing better than a perfectly poached egg for breakfast.   Wait can start increasing later in the morning even during weekdays so come early if you want to be seated right away.

Great food great portions great service - just a great place to really enjoy what you eat!!!!   The chicken sausage gravy will make you slap yo momma it's so good the biscuits are large and moist n fluffy the grits creamy and can be eaten just like they arrive at your table so far never disappointed- go for breakfast for sure I guarantee you'll not be disappointed
Absolutely delicious! Didn't have a wait at all. The best biscuits. And their caramel apple cider mimosa was so good

Damn you and your spellbinding biscuit black magic! I'm hooked!   This is the epitome of what a breakfast restaurant should be: a few simple fresh ingredients crafted to perfection.   I used to wait in line for a table at the Flying Biscuit locations in Atlanta, so far Charlotte hasn't caught on to their best kept secret. Always a a great dining experience!

Let me start off by saying I am NOT a fan of biscuits and grits. So when my friend suggested we try this place I was really hesitant to say yes because everything on the menu has biscuits and grits. Anyway, I didn't want to be a downer so I agreed to go, I figured I could just replace them with other things. Our waitress was super helpful and suggested I give the biscuit a try and just replace the grits with potatoes, which I did (btw I got the steak and eggs) When we got our food and I saw the biscuit, it looked amazing and I am happy to say it tasted even better. It wasn't dry like I was expecting, it was so soft and fluffy, I've never had a biscuit like this one. My friend also made me try her grits and to my surprise, they were also amazing! This place has really made me reconsider what I like and reminded me that I always need to try things in different places!

A perfect find while visiting Charlotte for a wedding with a group of friends.  GREAT menu, especially for veggie lovers and vegans.  Some of the best variety I've seen on a breakfast menu and the colorful, cheery atmosphere is great.  I honestly don't think the biscuits are great and some of the food was overly sauced, but overall awesome place.  Favorite quote of the meal: Me: How do you make the oatmeal pancakes? Waitress: With Oatmeal. My inner thought: Ohhhh ok!  That clears everything right up!

YUM!  Definitely a great atmosphere and fun decorations!  In a strip mall and somewhat hard to find, but deliciousness ensues once inside!  I've only gone during not so busy times, but the service is great!  Great, delicious vegan options as well! Try the Vegan BBQ burrito!  It's a little bit of heaven in a nice tortilla wrap!  I would recommend this place to anyone looking to soliciting their friends to Charlotte!  Awesome and trendy come to mind!!!  The wait staff have been very friendly and in fun moods and willing to offer legitimate suggestions, which is always a good meal experience for me!  They also off an extensive menu that includes dinner entrees and boast a menu with breakfast all day, so all you brinner people have a great lil haven in Charlotte!!! :)

I don't know why it is, but I've learned that whenever a restaurant has a particular dish in its name, that's usually the worst item on the menu. Flying Biscuit is no exception. The biscuits are thick, heavy and bland (though that apple butter or whatever sauce is amazing and helps things out a lot). So don't go expecting a big flaky delish biscuit.  But for breakfast, it's pretty hard to go wrong. I went on an early Saturday afternoon and had the Clifton omelette, with goat cheese, mushrooms and tomato, and it was just as good as it sounds. Hubby got the Piedmont and left not a speck on the plate. Service was a bit slow and unresponsive, and it wasn't even very busy. The waittress was young, but she just didn't seem very interested in serving or filling water or earning a tip? Still, neither the chicken nor the biscuit will dissuade me from stopping in again. Good deal--especially if you check in on 4square. Can I say that?

Thank you @theflyingbiscuitclt for a wonderful brunch and the super fantastic waitress we had only being her 3rd day there she was magnificent. Ed loved her called her a #southern #bronxgirl she was refreshing and wonderful. Just her attitude alone made me want to come back. The food now was off the charts goosebumps good . There's nothing on the menu that's not good. Now the drinks are also Kick-Ass. We will definitely be regular customers. Hire more people like that it was fantastic customer experience. #chefbella #food #foodie #greatplacetoeat

Turkey meatloaf sandwich...sounded great...then I bit into the dry, crumbly, cardboard flavored whole wheat, vegan, gluten free flavor missing bun.  In all honesty - it isn't a healthy restaurant - ditch the wheat buns, tone down the salt on the potatoes and I'll give it another try.   On the up side - phenomenal location!

I need to tell you first that my boyfriend and I were returning to Charlotte after a weekend trip to NYC. Since he has relocated to the area from California, I thought it would be fun to hit the reknown "Flying Biscuit Cafe" for breakfast (early early return flight). I had never been there, but have friends that rave. Anyway, the menu offers few truly healthy choices, but he was able to pick something. I picked the most popular breakfast platter. Can't remember the name, it's literally the first one on the menu. Anyway, my eggs were so-so, the chicken sausage disgusting (dry yet greasy???) and the biscuit was a little hard. I thought, "What is all the fuss about?" We were seated outside pretty quickly and the wait staff was pretty efficient and friendly. Anyway, I've had better (not just in NYC which blows this area away) so I most likely won't return.

This place is great! We are new to the area and heard tell of the long lines, but on two different weekends we've arrived around 9-10am and had no problem getting a table. Later on though, you definitely see the list getting longer and longer. THE GRITS, YOU GUYS. I could literally eat a bucket of them. Like I think I could win some kind of grits eating contest with them.   There are a lot of options and creative dishes beyond your usual breakfast fare.   One of the best things is we had our 10 month old with us and it is super kid friendly. We didn't feel awkward having him there, which you can certainly feel is the vibe with some other places.

This place is fun!   I do not eat pork so I like that everything comes with turkey bacon or their homemade chicken sausage. They have breakfast potatoes that have a good seasoning on them. Obviously you can get pork bacon if you want. Only complaint about the turkey bacon is was more like jerky!   The wait looked deceiving as we got seated pretty quick on a Sunday at 10a.

Disappointing. Strip mall bad; decor atrocious; Friday green tomato sandwich flavor overload - turkey bacon, cashew jalapeño sweet relish, goat cheese, fried green tomato and I asked to have it on a biscuit instead of a bun. The biscuit was dry and had sugar on top - weird! The macaroni and cheese sticks and potatoes next to the sandwich were better. They cut pieces of mac&cheese and browned them in a skillet - nice touch. Overall, on this one yelp let us down.
Flying Biscuit sounded like a promising place to eat breakfast during our recent visit to Charlotte.

While I didn't love this place, food-wise, I have to say the ambiance was great. I enjoyed the cloud-painted wall, the strings of lights, the cool paintings towards the rear, and the actual flying biscuit yellow and orange wall paper. Plus I'm a fan of garage door style walls like the one that made up this storefront. I'm not sure why but it reminds me of SoCal and makes a place feel so much more open and airy, even when it is closed!  We specifically ordered their unusuals--the inside out (crustless, really) pot pie and the grilled mac and cheese. It was going to be an extremely foodful day and were were hoping to start light. Oh well. With just those two items ordered, we were both unfortunately full after our visit. And while I didn't care for the pot stuffing (not enough veggies, too much potato), the biscuits (just didn't like the taste or texture, not my style at all), or the mac and cheese soufflé (too eggy/soft, not enough substance), my dining companion thought the pot pie and biscuit was the best best dish of the day (and we had about six meals that day). He really liked the practical and unique nature of the pie filling as well as how freakishly tall the biscuit was. Flying indeed!

This was our first time here but won't be our last! The food was really good, waitstaff was very friendly and getting our food didn't take long. My only negative comment would be that it was very very hot inside. I typically don't like to break a sweat at breakfast so this made us rush a little faster to eat and get out. The temp is controlled by the weather since they open the garage door in the front and all that is left is a large screen. (There's no bugs if you're worried about being exposed to the outside) but this place would be PHENOMENAL in the spring or fall :) even winter here in the south.

We ordered the egg extravaganza to share with side of fruit. I also tried their peach nectar. Place is very decorative and cute inside. Food came out fast. They only serve turkey bacon here I think. I much prefer the regular bacon. They make their own jam sauce here that they have in a jar on every table. The fruit they had in season was grape, melon, and pineapple. Portion of fruit was small for $4. Overall food was ok. First time here since we had a layover at airport so decided to explore Charlotte.

I'm not convinced this place is as wonderful as everyone in Charlotte seems to think it is, but Flying Biscuit is a solid entry on the breakfast/brunch market nonetheless. My biggest complaint about the place is that their biscuits really aren't anything special. Hard to believe at a place with biscuit in their name, right?!   I usually order a scramble of some sort. The veggie one is good and fresh, wanting for a little bit of seasoning. I've tried the turkey bacon and grits on different visits. Both were just ok.   If you don't get there before 9:30am on the weekend, expect to wait. The guy at the front (if you've been there, you know the one... with the awesome mustache) is always nice, welcoming you, opening the door for everyone, etc. I like that they have a huge space heater outside for the wait in winter months.   Service is very hit or miss. We've had super attentive servers on some visits and literally had to hunt someone down to pay on others.   Overall, a good, (usually) quick spot for a fresh breakfast but still working on consistency, I think.

Not impressed at all. I read so many great reviews so disappointment is an understatement. Had the pasta and sausage scramble, grits and biscuit. Pasta scramble was so bland it was unbelievable. Grits were ok, but had a rancid aftertaste to them, and biscuit was far too doughy. Also tried the Cajun chicken scramble, the only flavorful part was the sun dried tomatoes however they overpowered the dish. I will not be returning.

Why is southern food so amazingly delicious?! I have yet to be let down by any authentic southern dining experience and Flying Biscuit Cafe is no different! We tried coming here a few times to be turned off by the wait but if only I knew how satisfying the meal would be, I'd wait days   The atmosphere is awesome, very colorful and inviting. It reminded me of a cafe I used to work in during college and brought back so many great memories!   I ordered the tradition breakfast I believe it was called. Omg I had no idea how much food was about to be put in front of me. It was 2 eggs, grits, turkey sausage, a biscuit, and an organic oatmeal pancake. And to add to the crazy amount of food I already had, I decided to order a side of grilled Mac and cheese. Just thinking about it right now, my mouth is watering. The eggs were eggs, hard to mess up. Who knew turkey sausage could be so good compared to the real thing! Biscuit was out of this world, just fell apart and melted in my mouth. The grits were also something to note, so creamy and so cheesy, my favorite! The pancake was fantastic and didn't even need syrup. And finally, the Mac and cheese...I could eat this all day everyday. They were just the right amount of grilled and greasy enough to enjoy the fatness.   I can not wait to go and try some more of the endless items on the menu!!
So beyond yummy. Though a chain, I've been here and to another in Atlanta and they're consistently great. The menu is huge and varied and definitely have something for everyone. Highly recommend
Love Flying Biscuit!!! Nothing like a great breakfast on a beautiful Saturday morning!! Love the grits, chicken gravy and turkey bacon!!!

This place is always packed which is an indicator on how good the food is. Be prepared to wait if you come for brunch.  The Southern Egg Benedict is SO GOOD! You can mix and match sides from the breakfast & lunch side. Also, breakfast is SERVED ALL DAY! ALL DAY!! Whether you're eating breakfast or lunch, I highly recommend trying the grilled mac & cheese. The grits are called "creamy dreamy" and they definitely live up to the name.   Nom nom nom

I've been wanting to have some southern breakfast and this little family owned joint was spot on.  It was very busy but we only waited 15 minutes or so and I was excited to try some of the things I read on yelp.  The grits here were delicious!! The breakfast was like any normal breakfast... Eggs sausage.. But the grits were so cheesy and creamy!! It really was the most unexpected deliciousness. The biscuit was a little dry and the butter that everyone talked about was more of a jam and in a squeezable tube.  Did not live up to the hype. The grits made my experience!!

If you are looking for a breakfast place in Charlotte, head over to the Flying Biscuit. This has to be one of my favorite breakfast places in Charlotte. Everything is pretty much homemade, from their biscuits to sausage gravy. So far I haven't had a mean that disappoints. My suggestions would be the Breakfast Bowl, Biscuits and Gravy, & the Turkey Hash. The Turkey Hash has extremely tender turkey over top of a bed of potatoes. The Breakfast Bowl not only looks pretty, it tastes pretty amazing too; 2 eggs over 2 fried green tomatoes over a bed of creamy grits with salsa. The great news is they sell Breakfast all day! The location in Charlotte is always packed but they cycle through people pretty quickly. A great place to bring visitors or just a good Sunday morning brunch! They also cater, so consider it when deciding on a Breakfast caterer, it's a great choice that the office will love.

One of the best southern breakfast we've ever had. Stopping looking for breakfast options, you found it. Claudia, our waitress, was so friendly and helpful. Never visit Charlotte, but when we do, we're not looking for another place to "try".
Delicious food and delicious coffee, get there early. Show it's a great community in this restaurant will not disappoint

Been here with the wife a couple of times. The wait can be tough on the weekends. My wife is a bigger breakfast fan than I am. I'm usually the one who prefers to eat light at home for breakfast and have a nice lunch out. But every now and then you want to try new things, so we gave the flying biscuit a shot.   We both enjoyed our food and noticed that a lot of the dishes had a more healthy twist to them. I think that I'll enjoy the flying biscuit when I'm in the mood for it, but I think that my wife and I are more traditionalists when it comes to breakfast. She's a big fan of bacon and I tend to enjoy pork sausage. I do remember enjoying the pancakes and she enjoyed the grits, but outside of that I think I'm more in my comfort zone at Waffle House or ihop.  But the service is terrific and the food is done well. I'd come back if I was craving that type of breakfast.

Came here specifically because they supposedly had extensive gluten free options. About half if the items on the menu are marked as "gluten free" but the once I started questioning the server I learned that there is no dedicated prep area and the majority of the "gluten free" items are made on the same surface as their regular-full of gluten-pancakes.  Needless to say we left. They did earn one extra star for at least admitting that their gluten free menu is really only for those who have mild issues with gluten and that it isn't safe for celiacs

I like the food here and usually come every few weeks with friends. However, the service staff is always rude or disinterested and it makes the experience awkward.   Today, l came in before 3 and didn't realize that the closing time was earlier because it was Monday. The short male server took us to the table set the menu down and said "you better hurry up because we close in three minutes" before walking away.  I left because I'd never intentionally come in so close to closing. I won't return again because I'm not paying you to be rude every time I come to your restaurant. There are plenty of other places much closer to NoDa, so don't waste a trip to Park Rd for this shit

It's funny how you think a cool hip place is gonna have this stellar food and it's just meh? Like wow this was a dud...  Went here today for brunch and we all got breakfast items. I guess with a name like flying biscuits you're expecting amazing biscuits right?, well these were not. I mean I guess they were not terrible but they were not soft and fluffy like they looked. The sausage is very dense too and hard to cut with a fork. Most sausage I've made at home slices easily with a fork, I'm not sure why theirs did not but it was strange? The grits however are super tasty because it has a lot of butter but who cares it was very good. I got a latte but it had too much steamed milk, i was not a fan. The sledgehammer was much better and is basically a breve, which is what I make at home all the time.   I don't know what to tell you folks, maybe their lunch meals are better than breakfast but I don't think I'll chance it again to find out. The flying biscuit gets an official rating of Meh in my book. On to the next one!

This was our 1st visit & we were very impressed.  Even on a busy Sunday morning the wait was only about 15 minutes.  This location has only been here about two years but have definitely got a following.  We understand why!  Hubba-bubba got the orange-infused whole wheat french toast with a biscuit on the side.  The french toast was scrumptious!  I'm sure people swear by their biscuits, but I wasn't a big fan of them.  I did like that they have apple butter on the table, that was a nice touch...not quite my fave apple butter from Liverpool, PA, but unexpected & delightful in Charlotte, NC!    I got the High Flyer & fell in love with their creamy & yes they are butter-dreamy grits.  I liked the oatmeal pancake, but it could have even been a bit smaller as it is a very dense "pancake".    The service was as excellent as the food.  We are very happy to have found a new breakfast place that is low-key excellence!  Their decor is fun and bright without being overwhelming or kitschy.  They also have a front, sidewalk patio & a back balcony patio.  I think they have free wi-fi, too!  They also have an excellent Mocha!  That was delicious & served in a big-sized coffee cup.  For two breakfasts, our individual drinks & a to-go drink it was $25.  We liked the rest of the menu & look forward going back for lunch or dinner.  Yay for Flying Biscuit Cafe'.

Oh. My. Yum. I love this place so much! Even though there's always a wait on the weekends, it's totally worth it (and you'll only wait about 20 mins)! Get the Southern Style Benedict.. It'll change your life.
Takeout regular, the grits ARE dreamy and I love the turkey bacon, sausage. The chocolate bread pudding is new twist to it too. Recommend greatly.

One of my fave go to places for great breakfast. My favorite is Ballantyne,  Jasmine is at Park Road.  She is amazing Hostess.  Great biscuit and gravy,  Eggs scrambled soft with cheese,  Cranberry sauce really good on Oatmeal pancake for a sweet treat.

My manager wanted to treat lunch today using Foodie Call, the team ordered the BLT with turkey bacon and goat cheese and 2 side orders of green tomatoes.  Well it was not at all the flavor of the description, the potatoes were cold and bland, as well as everything else.  No cutlery, ketchup, naps, etc. was packed.  The side of green tomatoes was four (4) thin cut for 6.99; my manager was refunded the cost of lunch, thank you.  I gave two (2) stars for delivery and  refund.

Another one of my favorite spots in Charlotte. I had the turkey hash today, and it was PERFECT. Turkey with gravy on top of roasted potatoes and topped with an over medium egg and melted cheese. Our food came out piping hot, and so was the coffee. The turkey hash looked so delicious when it came out that I accidentally cut into it before snapping a picture! I was ready to dig in, and ended up stuffing my face! The biscuit with apple butter is one of my favorite things about the Flying Biscuit, it is definitely one of their staples. Everything comes out tasting homemade and fresh.   Staff is always friendly and service is on point. There is usually a wait here on the weekends during breakfast hours, so we like to go around lunchtime. I also recommend one of the many flavored mimosas and the espresso shot.   ***UPDATE*** I had this place at 5 stars, but had to drop them to 4 when I've recently had poor service here. The last time I went for a late lunch, my server wasn't helpful with the menu at all, acted as if we were taking up too much of her time, and never got a coffee or water refill for the whole sitting.
I love this place for breakfast and lunch. The options are great for a vegetarian and the staff is friendly.  My favorite are the soft & yummy biscuits!!!
I love that rustic feel. The staff is very hospitable & the food was good and reasonably priced. LXF

Great brunch/breakfast on a Sunday at around noon. At first, we were a bit disappointed by the 30 minute wait however in retrospect, it was worth it. Where do i start? I suppose we can review the highlights.  *Service - Friendly and quick. Appropriate number of servers, warm older gent outside the restaurant doing a nice job of keeping tabs of the waiting list and accoomodating the different size parties and available seats outside, inside at tables, and inside at the counter. Bravo to him! Wait service was very customer service focused with our waiter bringing an extra biscuit at the same time  the food bringer and he just let us have the extra freee of charge..well there you go, enjoy! We weren't charged for extra delciious little sides or any changes we requested.  They were very accomodating and for the amount of people in there, they were relatively speedy. *Atmosphere- cozy and more room inside than one would think. You can dine outside or inside and come with your family without issue. There was a group of 7 even that was accomodated. Casual and comfortable. You can wear whatever the heck ya please here. *Menu- was very surprised how many choices they had! There were about 15 different breakfast specials of which half were on my "hmm i would love that!" List. Our entire party of 4 had a hard time deciding! They have wonderful egg specials, oatmeal pancakes, french toasts, lots of aide dishes ans an ability to subsitute pretty easily. If you want lunch they had a pretty good variety there too with salads, sandwiches and fun lunch options. I would come.back for lunch because the combinations of food sounded amazing! *Food- finally, huh? Ok the food was delicious. Period. I had three scrambled eggs with smoked salmon, and dill cream cheese and added grilled onions (that i saw from another dish that i was torn between) with a side of moon dusted potatoes (which was a subsitute instead of grits) and a biscuit of course. Note that all the breakfast specials  (which are served all day) all come with a biscuit. The biscuits are definitely very good but not amazing  (i guess after you've had Biscuit Head biscuits in Asheville, its a tad unfair to compare with those monstrous mounds of deliciousness ). The eggs were very good and they were geneous with the salmon and such. Potatoes were pretty good but i would have kept the grits as a side if I had known how delciious they were. I tried someone else's at our table and it was incredibly creamy and wonderful. Arguably the best i have ever had. I am not even a big fan of grits but this could change my mind! So to the other reviewer who indicated this was the best he ever had anywhere, we concur (although one person in my party claims to have had better grits at a place in Charleston however admitted this was excellent). As for other dishes, the whole wheat French toast smothered in raspberry compote (as part of Eggstravaganza) was unreal. We asked for extra of that raspberry stuff and layered it on our biscuits and it was TDF. The oatmeal pancakes were also wonderful and very filling. Hearty and super tasty. Another at our table had eggs underneath  smothered biscuits n gravy but it was not normal sausage gravy. It was chicken sausage gravy which was a fantastic alternative to pork (which i dont care for anyway) and was scrumptious and addictive. I believe the chicken sausage is one of their signature sides and is well worth it. They also offer turkey bacon with many of their dishes. This was probably the one item which was subpar in my opinion. It was the dry and chewy almost tasting like jerky. I love good turkey bacon and this was a let down. Please skip this item and order the rest of it because the rest of the food was incredibly good! *Prices - i felt this was a bit overpriced as each breakfast special was about $10 each. Certainly not out of bounds just on the higher side. I would exect 6to8 bucks each. Maybe I am being a little critical.here however even the sides were over $3 each. We dropped  $55 after tax/tip here with 4 people...seems reasonable for lunch but because we had just breakfast items i thought a tad high. *Portions -Generous so it helped justify the price. The biscuits and pancakes were very heavy so tread lightly and share if you're a light eater! I am a heavy eater but my plate plus nibbling from others combined with an iced coffee made me quite full. The women in our party gave upnhalf way through...lol  Wish i could give 4 &  1/2 stars. Everything except the turkey bacon was delish and service and menu were excellent. I would not hesitate to go back and you should go if youre thinking about it. Be prepared to potentially wait....by the way, this is in a busy strip mall.but there is plenty of parking. I suggest you arrive 30 minutes prior to when you would want to sit down just so you can get a table if theyre swamped on a weekend like today.  Bravo to this place though. One of the best breaskfasts/brunches  in all of Charlotte!

Before our conscious uncoupling with Foodie Call we used to order from Flying Biscuit all the time, but I had not been to the actual establishment until this past weekend. I am so happy I am able to give a 5 star for my 100th review!   Going into it I already knew their food was great. If a restaurant can consistently deliver delicious food offsite I have high expectations for meals that only have to travel from the kitchen to the table.   We arrived a little before 10 am and had no problem getting a table for two out front. The weather was great and sitting outside meant we could hang out with the people who brought their dogs. I had no idea it was a dog friendly establishment and my furry companion will definitely join me next time!   Sitting down I knew I needed coffee and that somehow my order needed to include their chicken sausage patties. I am normally pretty picky about sausage but I love the sausage here. I happily ate both patties by myself. The latte they brought out was beautiful and delicious. I decided to order the turkey hash which is the best brunch dish. Turkey so tender and covered in a delicious sauce that it tastes like a pot roast served over potatoes. The whole thing was topped with two over medium eggs smothered in cheese. Perfection!   The biscuit that came with the meal was soft and warm (it is pretty hard when we had it delivered before so a big improvement). I drowned my biscuit in the delicious apple butter they leave table side for the perfect combination of sweet and savory. Maybe next time I will bring a large purse so the apple butter can come home with me...   I did not see the inside but I already know I will be back soon. The service was attentive and the menu is so unique and everything I have ever ordered from there has been absolutely delicious.

I had high hopes for this place however the reality was sobbering. I ordered the flat iron steak and eggs what a disappointment everything we order ws a disappointment. However my daughter enjoyed her shrimp and grits. For the most part the food was under seasoned and not tasted. We love trying new places but this one isn't it. I didn't even care for the biscuits the tops were hard...big isn't always better. Their apple butter ws good.
